properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Apple Final Cut Studio Classes at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: FUTURE MEDIA CONCEPTS, INC.,the nation's premier digital media training center, provides manufacturer-authorized training in all areas of digital media including digital video and film editing, web design and development, sound design, DVD authoring, 3D animation, motion graphics, desktop publishing, architectural and mechanical design and Mac IT. FMC is an authorized training provider for Adobe, Apple, Autodesk, Avid, Boris FX, Digidesign, NewTek and Softimage. Call: 202-429-9700DVDSP 101 - An Introduction to DVD Studio Pro 4 - 3 days 06/28-0630/2010, 08/05-0807/2010 This three day hands-on course delves into the world of DVD authoring using DVD Studio Pro 4. In this comprehensive course students will learn everything they need to create a professional DVD title. This course guides students through every aspect of DVD authoring, from initial storyboarding to burning and replication. Using compelling media and a real-world production workflow, students will learn how to create amazing MPEG 2 video with Compressor as well as create eye-popping motion menus directly in DVD Studio Pro 4. Students will also "author" a DVD by creating buttons, interactive links, slideshows, playlists and even adding alternate audio stream and camera angles.Motion 101 - An Introduction to Motion 4 - 3 days 06/25-0627/2010, 0802-0804/2010, 0913-0915/2010 This three-day hands-on course will familiarize students with Motion, Apple's revolutionary software for motion graphics design. The course comprehensively covers working with Motion's Real-Time Design engine and interface, behavior-based animation, parameter behaviors, blend modes, advanced particle system design, advanced title animation, working with templates, chroma key techniques, masking methods, DVD motion menu design, tablet-driven gesture UI techniques, working with audio, keyframing, and integration. This course is designed for those students who wish to learn the fundamentals and functionality of Motion.STP 101 - Introduction to Soundtrack Pro 2 - 2 days 0712-0713/2010, 0812-0813/2010, 1007-1008/2010, 1129-1130/2010, 1220-1221/2010 This two-day class guides you through using Soundtrack Pro to edit audio files, repair field recordings, perform multitrack arranging and mixing, synchronize audio and video, analyze and fix common audio problems, and perform other creative sound design techniques. This course focuses on practical, professional techniques used to add professional music and sound effects to video and multimedia projects. *** Class Duration: 10am-6pm *** For more info go to www.fmctraining.com Future Media Concepts 1627 K St NW, Suite 900 Washington DC, 20006 Tel: 202-429-9700 Fax: 202-429-9898

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Otakon 2010 at Baltimore Convention Center
properties.description: Otakon is a Japanese Anime Convention where people from all over gather to enjoy the thing that all of us have in common and that is our love for Japanese Anime. Jul 11, 2010: Brian Jungen: Strange Comfort at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: This major survey of Brian Jungen transforms the familiar and banal into exquisite objects that reference themes of globalization, pop culture, museums, and the commodification of Indian imagery. On display in this exhibit are iconic works, as well as major pieces never before seen in the United States.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Written in Bone: Forensic Files of the 17th Century Chesapeake at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Human anatomy and forensic investigation provide intriguing information on people and events of America's past. This exhibition will examine history through 17th-century bone biographies, including those of colonists teetering on the edge of survival at Jamestown, VA, and those of wealthy and well-established individuals of St. Mary's City, MD.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Washington: Symbol and City at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibition explores how residents experience the city and how Washington itself expresses the tension between the demands of a working seat of government and the desire for a national symbol, and the hopes and needs of an evolving city.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Mummified at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: Visitors can experience the virtual autopsy and learn more about ancient Egyptian mummification at two computer stations. The exhibition will display approximately 20 ancient Egyptian objects, showing images of mummified person, animals and deities while explaining the resurrection symbolism of ancient Egyptian mummies.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Mummified at The Walters Art Museum

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Taking Shape: Ceramics in Southeast Asia at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Approximately 200 diverse and visually striking ceramic vessels from Southeast Asia are on display in this exhibit. 'Taking Shape' presents the two basic types of ceramics produced in Southeast Asia - soft, porous earthenware and high-fired stoneware.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Alphabetilately at National Postal Museum
properties.description: The stamps, ephemera and artifacts exhibited in this exhibit graphically document the spectrum of the American experience, from historical subjects to popular culture and from actual events to important ideas. 'Alphabetilately' showcases selections from the Museum's unparalleled collection of American postal and philatelic history.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Textiles Recycled/Reimagined at Baltimore Museum of Art
properties.description: This intimate exhibition presents a dozen unique objects made either wholly or in part from reused and/or repurposed materials.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Paint - American Decorative Arts Gallery at Baltimore Museum of Art
properties.description: Discover a dazzling sample of japanned, ebonized, grained, and polychromed American and European furniture. On display are bold 18th- and 19th-century clocks, cabinets, tables and chairs - gathered from Baltimore, Boston and beyond.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: The Cone Collection at Baltimore Museum of Art
properties.description: On display at the Museum are works by Matisse, Picasso, Pissarro, Courbet and a self-portrait by Degas.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: A Grand Legacy: Five Centuries of European Art at Baltimore Museum of Art
properties.description: This exhibit showcases the monumental Rinaldo and Armida, one of the world's finest paintings by Sir Anthony van Dyck, as well as masterpieces by Frans Hals, Rembrandt van Rijn, and Jean Baptiste Simeon Chardin.

properties.description: This exhibit will highlight the historical and cultural breadth of the Textile Museum's collection through the display of textile furnishings, including hangings, rugs, chair covers, cushions and other materials made in societies ranging from the late Roman Empire and colonial Peru to Edo-period Japan and Victorian Britain.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Holidays on Display at National Museum of American History
properties.description: The exhibition examines the art, industry and history of the commercial holiday displays that enchanted the public from the 1920s to the 1960s. On display are numerous photographs, postcards and illustrations of parade floats and window displays, as well as objects relating to the early creation of these displays.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: The Art of Gaman: Arts and Crafts From the Japanese American Internment Camps, 1942-1946 at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: This exhibit will showcase arts and crafts made by Japanese Americans in U.S. internment camps during World War II. On display will be more than 100 objects, many of which are on loan from former internees or their families. The exhibition is based on Delphine Hirasuna's 2005 book 'The Art of Gaman.'

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Since Darwin: the Evolution of Evolution at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Join others in celebrating the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin's birth and the 150th anniversary of the publication of his groundbreaking 'On the Origin of Species.' Specimens from the Museum's diverse collections, along with documentation from ongoing research, illustrate the importance of evolution as a scientific foundation, and how our knowledge of evolution has evolved over the last 150 years.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Since Darwin: the Evolution of Evolution at National Museum of Natural History

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness at American Visionary Art Museum
properties.description: The quest for human rights and the search for personal fulfillment, as proposed in the 1776 American Declaration of Independence, provide the starting point for this upcoming international exhibition. Works by the last surviving descendant of the Tsars of Russia, Iroquois Indians, French Revolutionaries, illegal immigrants, Algerian War veterans, Guantanamo Bay detainees, Holocaust survivors, incarcerated prisoners, African-American civil rights activists and Iraqi doctors are among the 50 visionary artists to be featured.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Inside Tim Russert's Office: If It's Sunday, It's 'Meet the Press' at Newseum
properties.description: One of the country's most respected journalists, Tim Russert moderated 'Meet the Press' for nearly 17 years. This exhibit recreates Russert's NBC Washington office much as it looked when he died of a heart attack in June 2008 while preparing for his next show. Family, faith and sports were important themes in Russert's life, as evidenced by his favorite books, family photos and mementos of his beloved Buffalo Bills that line his office. A Newseum-produced video features some of Russert's more memorable interviews and remembrances from those who worked with him and knew him best.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: German Master Drawings From the Wolfgang Ratjen Collection - 1580-1900 at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: This stunning exhibition, featuring 120 of the finest German drawings from the Wolfgang Ratjen Collection, showcases major works ranging from the 17th-century baroque and 18th-century rococo to early 19th-century romanticism and late 19th-century realism.

properties.description: This exhibit will bring together 84 of the finest French and American paintings that Chester Dale and his wife Maud, an artist and critic, assembled from the 1920s through the 1950s.

properties.description: This exhibit will bring together 84 of the finest French and American paintings that Chester Dale and his wife Maud, an artist and critic, assembled from the 1920s through the 1950s.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Darwin's Legacy at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: November 2009 marks the 150th anniversary of the 1859 publication of Charles Darwin's groundbreaking 'On the Origin of Species.' Learn how Darwin's theory found supporters at the Smithsonian, and how it continues to guide research at the National Museum of Natural History.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Abraham Lincoln Certified Plate Proofs at National Postal Museum
properties.description: On view in the Philatelic Gallery pullout frames at the Museum are 11 certified plate proofs for postage stamps honoring Abraham Lincoln. Certified plate proofs are the last printed proof of the plate before printing the stamps. These plate proofs are each unique, with the approval signatures and date. Issued from 1894 to 1959, the stamps feature a variety of Lincoln portraits.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Cornucopia: Ceramics From Southern Japan at Freer Gallery of Art
properties.description: Around the year 1600, a heightened fascination with the design and uses of ceramics, combined with advances in technology, launched an era of extraordinarily diverse and accomplished ceramic production in Japan, particular the island of Kyushu. Hundreds of kilns produced both stoneware coated in muted glazes and porcelain ornamented with cobalt blue or multicolored enamels for the domestic market (with a focus on utensils for dining and for the tea ceremony) and for export to Europe and Southeast Asia.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Cornucopia: Ceramics From Southern Japan at Freer Gallery of Art

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Intersections Art Projects - Tayo Heuser: Pulse at The Phillips Collection
properties.description: Tayo Heuser translates the luminosity of Mark Rothko's paintings into three dimensions with large-scale wall-mounted sculptures of glowing, colored forms drawn in ink, designed to rise along the spiral flow of the Goh Annex stairwell. The work was created in response to both the architecture of the stairwell and the paintings in the museum's Rothko Room. This exhibit is part of Intersections Art Projects, in which artists respond to art and spaces in the Phillips with projects of their own.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Golden Triangle Summer Concert Series at Farragut Square Park and Golden Triangle Park
properties.description:
Downtown DC heats up again this summer with the free Golden Triangle Summer Concert Series (formerly known as "Sounds in the Square") held in Farragut Square Park on Thursday evenings from 5:30 p.m to 7:30 p.m. in June and July.
Come enjoy warm summer evenings with free live music and friends.  End your Thursday nights with the funk and blues sounds of Kelly Bell or the popular music from Dave Matthews tribute band, Crowded Streets.  You can even learn how to salsa with Sin Miedo.  This lineup of DC’s most popular bands guarantees a great time for everyone! Check out the Golden Triangle Concert Series in the heart of DC’s downtown Golden Triangle neighborhood- where there is always something more than just great music to keep you entertained.
Golden Triangle Summer Concerts 2010 Lineup:
June 3 – Kelly Bell (blues & funk)
June 10 – Jah Works (reggae)
June 17 – Lloyd Dobler Effect (rock)
June 24 – Road Soda (variety rock covers)
July 1 – Cazhmiere (funk & soul)
July 8 – Sin Miedo (Latin & salsa)
July 15 – Crowded Streets (Dave Matthews tribute)

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Healing & Relaxation: Guided Meditation at Mindful Hands
properties.description: Feeling stressed?  Join Dona Witten, Phd, of Integrated LifePath Coaching (www.integratedlifepathcoaching.com) every Thursday for Guided Meditation.  Learn practical relaxation tools to help you cope with stress, uncertainty, and anxiety.  We will use guided relaxation exercises and calming contemplations. Free, donations gratefully accepted.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Mindfulness Meditation at Mindful Hands
properties.description: Join Dona Witten, PhD, of Integrated LifePath Coaching (www.integratedlifepathcoaching.com), every Monday as she leads you in a mindfulness mini-retreat. These sessions consist of three silent sitting sessions of twenty minutes each, with a 10-minute walking meditation in between. Free, donations gratefully accepted.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Candlelight Yoga at Mindful Hands

Drop-in rate is $15, 6-week pass for $65.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Mind & Meditation: Introduction to the Art of Living at Art of Living National Center
properties.description: Relax and rejuvenate at Mind & Meditation: Introduction to the Art of Living. This workshop is free community service initiative to learn the tools to live healthy, stress-free lives. Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from Art of Living programs such as this one. In this 60-minute session, you will learn powerful breathing-techniques, experience a guided meditation and learn about the nature of the mind - all to dissolve stress, leaving you with a smile. This workshop also includes an introduction to the Art of Living Course. Come explore the power of your breath and meditation. To learn more watch a video from MSNBC at: http://us.artofliving.org/video/player-wmv.html?videofile... properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Free Hoopernatural Hoop Jam at Canal Park
properties.description: A Hoop Jam is an informal, no experience necessary, open-to-the-public way try out modern hooping and to meet other hoopers in the DC community.  Hoop Jams are not formal classes but will give you an opportunity to try hooping.  This hoop jam is for adults and children.  Hoops will be provided.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Capital Harvest on the Plaza Farm Market at Woodrow Wilson Plaza
properties.description:
Located on the Woodrow Wilson Plaza, The Capital Harvest on the Plaza Farm Market's mission is to bring quality, locally grown fresh produce and related products from the farms to the consumers’ table as well as providing the tools necessary to implement a healthy lifestyle. This Farm Market gives the farmers, producers, crafters and artisans from around the Chesapeake region the opportunity to provide a wide variety of quality fresh produce and related products directly to the consumer at affordable prices. 
The Farm Market will also be showcasing local chefs who will demonstrate dishes inspired by the produce available at the Farm Market, along with tasting samples and recipe, on a weekly basis. Live musical entertainment will accommodate this communal experience!
The Capital Harvest on the Plaza Farmers Market is supported by the GSA.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: 5.5.10 Elevated Entertainment Presents: "Takin' It Back" w/ DJ Alizay & DJ Cuzzin B at Napoleon
properties.description: .:5.5.10:. The GRAND OPENING of "Takin" It Back" Napoleon Champagne Bar & Lounge 5:30 - 2AM You are invited to the Grand Opening of "Takin' It Back" on Wednesday, May 5th, 2010 in the lower-level Metropolitan Room at the luxurious Napoleon Champagne Bar & Lounge. Napoleon Lounge is located at 1847 Columbia Road Northwest, near the intersection of 18th & Columbia Road. Sound Providers for the evening of 5.5.10 include: DJ Alizay (WKYS 93.3/Alize Mix Squad/Wale's Tour DJ) DJ Cuzzin B (True School Corp/Soul 4 Sale) Jerome Baker III (Bent On World Domination/Napoleon) DJ Freaky Ty (Blak Marigold Productions/Sinsationals) DJ Cerebral (Living Room/Elevated Entertainment) DJ Triptych WKYS 93.9 radio personality Ill Will will be your master of ceremonies. "Takin' It Back" is what we intend to do weekly in the Metropolitan Room at Napoleon Champagne Lounge, with each DJ delivering their own interpolation of 90's music. Ranging from classic hip hop and house, to 90's soul and go-go, we have you covered - Mark Morrison to Gangstarr and everywhere in between. properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Roof Terrace Restaurant hosts a Magical Afternoon Tea Party at Roof Terrace Restaurant
properties.description:
Mary Poppins is floating into The Kennedy Center this summer and in honor of the charmed caretaker, the KC Café is hosting a Magical Afternoon Tea Party after every matinee performance. Starting on Saturday, July 3rd, the KC Café will welcome youngsters for a late afternoon tea with cupcake decorating, mini-sandwiches, cookies, and a visit by a chim chim-in-ey chimney sweep. The tea party will take place from 4:15 p.m. – 5:15 p.m. and is priced at $25 for children and $29 for adults. 
During the tea, Pastry Chef Ben McCormick will visit with the kids to discuss cupcake making and decorating tips before they dive in and create their own edible masterpieces.  The menu is stacked with kid friendly treats like mini- Nutella and banana, butter and strawberry jam, and ham and cheese sandwiches, as well as cookies, and fruit tarts all served with lemonade, ice tea and fruit punch. 
Parents shall fear not, there will be something for everyone. As the kiddies decorate cupcakes, adults can relax and enjoy the unmatched view of the Washington, DC skyline while delighting in a tea of their own with mini- pimento cheese and smoked salmon with dill crème fraiche sandwiches, European macaroons, scones and a variety of hot teas like earl gray, green tea and lady gray. There will also be wine and cava available for purchase.  
The Magical Afternoon Tea Party will be held after every matinee from July 1st through August 22nd. Space is limited and reservations are required. To make reservations please contact Jeff Wingate at 202-416-8559. 
In addition, Executive Chef Joe Gurner at the Roof Terrace Restaurant at the Kennedy Center is taking cues from Ms. Poppins and will present family friendly menus. Please check the website at www.roofterracerestaurant.com for more information.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: The Marvelous Mouth at National Museum of Dentistry
properties.description: Discover the wide world of braces, mouthguards and dangers to the mouth with hands-on models and an animated computer game.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: GV Black: Father of American Dentistry at National Museum of Dentistry
properties.description: See a vignette of G.V. Black's circa 1870 dental office - featuring his Archer dental chair, a foot-powered dental engine that he invented, and hand instruments designed by Black to place silver amalgam fillings. A touchscreen computer kiosk allows visitors to flip through a "photo album" of Black's life to learn more about his home and family, scientific breakthroughs, and the legacy of his work.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: The Smile Experience at National Museum of Dentistry
properties.description: 'The Smile Experience' exhibit is a dazzling multimedia presentation that reveals the amazing power of a smile. Journey around the world to see how people have sought to enhance their smiles through the ages. See how the ancient Mayans decorated their teeth with jade and the Elizabethans whitened their teeth with acid. Discover the beginning of the modern age of cosmetic dentistry when Dr. Irwin Smigel, the father of aesthetic dentistry, introduced tooth bonding to the American public on the popular TV show 'That's Incredible.' See actual before-and-after cases that reveal the science and artistry of cosmetic dentistry through remarkable real-life smile transformations. Test your celebrity savvy in the Guess the Smile game, matching the smiles of iconic stars of movies, sports and music with their owners.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Modern Dental Operatory: Technology's Impact on Dentistry at National Museum of Dentistry
properties.description: This exhibition showcases some of the most technologically advanced dental treatment systems available for dental offices. Discover how these new systems positively impact a dental office experience by improving the quality of procedures and reducing time in the dental office.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Supporting the Force: Navy Supply in Action - Ready for Sea, Ready Ashore at US Navy Memorial
properties.description: Navy Supply provides the "beans, bullets and black oil" that enable the US Navy to operate around the globe. Navy Supply touches the lives of every sailor with food, laundry, barbers, postal services and ship's stores. On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Victory Mail at National Museum of American
properties.description: This exhibit showcases the Museum's collection of World War II V-Mail correspondence. V for Victory, a popular symbol of the Second World War, was the inspiration for the name of this new fangled correspondence style.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Perspectives: Hai Bo at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Trained as a painter, Hai Bo, born in 1962 in Changchun, China, took up photography in the 1980s as he became captivated by the camera's ability to stop time and evoke memories. For over two decades, he has been returning to his hometown in Jilin Province to capture the people and places of his youth, creating deeply moving portraits of resilience amidst the growing isolation of rural China. On display are five stunning, large scale photographs from his Northern Series. These images allow viewers to enter the vast panoramas of the artist's childhood memories, observe the subtle changes of nature across seasons, and encounter the gentle transience of life.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: First Dogs: Presidential Pets in the White House at Newseum
properties.description: One of the Newseum's most popular exhibits showcases some of the top dogs who have resided at the nation's most prestigious address. On display are images of dogs belonging to 23 presidents, including the newest addition: Bo, a six-month-old Portuguese water dog.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Elvis - His Groundbreaking, Hip-Shaking, Newsmaking Story at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Contemporary Craft and Decorative Arts at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: The museum's Renwick Gallery is home to the nation's premier collection of American studio craft and contemporary decorative arts. The permanent collection features works in all of the craft media - glass, ceramic, wood, fiber and metal - as well as mixed media objects. Jewelry and studio furniture make up a significant part of the collection.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Bird Watching at Great Falls Park
properties.description: Meet in the Visitor Center Courtyard.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Global Warming Facts and Our Future at Marian Koshland Science Museum of the National Academy of Sciences
properties.description: Explore the current facts about climate change, including its potential causes and the possible future effects of global warming. Museum visitors will also learn about the personal, national and international actions that could reduce the negative effects of global warming.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Lights at Night at Marian Koshland Science Museum of the National Academy of Sciences
properties.description: Explore the Earth at night by zooming in on your hometown or places far away. Compare images from 1993, 1997 and 2003 to infer changes in population, energy consumption, energy efficiency and economic activity.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Black Box: Chris Chong Chan Fui at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: Chris Chan Chong Fui, who lives and works in Kuala Lumpur, is the first Malaysian artist to present work at the Hirshhorn.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Colorforms at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: This selection of artworks from the Hirshhorn's collection, along with several paintings on loan from the National Gallery's renowned Mark Rothko holdings, date from the post-war era to the present and demonstrate color's inimitable capacity to evoke spatial structures as well as more elusive effects.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Colorforms at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: This selection of artworks from the Hirshhorn's collection, along with several paintings on loan from the National Gallery's renowned Mark Rothko holdings, date from the post-war era to the present and demonstrate color's inimitable capacity to evoke spatial structures as well as more elusive effects.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Yves Klein: With the Void - Full Powers at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: The exhibition will include examples from all of Klein's major series, including his 'Anthropometries,' 'Cosmogonies,' fire paintings, planetary reliefs, and blue monochromes, as well as selections of his lesser-known gold and pink monochromes, body and sponge reliefs, "air architecture," and immaterial works. The installation will also foreground the artist's process and conceptual projects through a range of ephemera, including sketches, photographs, letters, and writings.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Blood, Sweat and Saline: Combat Medicine in the Korean Conflict at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit features surgical instruments used in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital and an artificial kidney machine used in the field. The exhibit makes the story of medicine during the Korean War come to life through photographs and the personal recollections of medics, patients and military personnel.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Growing Up in Washington at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit features photos and reminiscences that recall museum experiences spanning the past 140 years, featuring memories of childhood visits.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: From A Single Cell at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit documents human development from the embryonic stage to age five and includes real human specimens from the museum's Human Developmental Anatomy Collection (HDAC). It also features anatomical models and images that demonstrate different growth patterns and developmental stages before and after birth.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: From A Single Cell at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit documents human development from the embryonic stage to age five and includes real human specimens from the museum's Human Developmental Anatomy Collection (HDAC). It also features anatomical models and images that demonstrate different growth patterns and developmental stages before and after birth.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Grand Salon Installation - Paintings From the Smithsonian American Art Museum at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: This installation features 70 paintings from the Smithsonian American Art Museum's collection. On display will be landscapes, portraits, and allegorical works by 51 American artists from the 1840s to the 1930s. The room is installed salon style, with paintings hung one-atop-another and side by side. A visitor guide will be available in the Grand Salon with short biographies of the artists.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Lama, Patron, Artist: the Great Situ Panchen at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Learn more about Situ Panchen (1700-1774) - artist, teacher and founder of the Palpung monastery. Thangkas designed and painted by Situ Panchen, sculptures of his chosen deity Tara, and Chinese works from the Freer's collection reveal Situ's genius, his enduring influence, and his engagement with Buddhist culture across Asia.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Our Peoples: Giving Voice to Our Histories at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Learn how Native people intentionally and strategically kept their cultures alive in the wake of the arrival of newcomers in the Western Hemisphere.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Guided Tours of Woodlawn Plantation at Woodlawn Plantation
properties.description: Woodlawn, a gracious 126-acre estate, was originally part of George Washington's Mount Vernon. In 1952, Woodlawn became the first historic site owned by The National Trust for Historic Preservation. Guided tours are provided every thirty minutes with the last tour at 4 pm.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Baltimore Farmers' Market & Bazaar at Downtown Baltimore
properties.description: As Maryland's largest producers-only market, visitors can enjoy a one-of-a-kind shopping experience with economical prices. While strolling the market, shoppers can revel at the sight of the largest quantity of the freshest fruits and vegetables, organically raised and produced dairy products including a variety of cheeses, milk, yogurt and butter, and meats such as beef, pork, lamb, bison, chicken, turkey and capon; a complete selection of fresh fish, eggs, breads and pastries from Maryland area farmers, spices and salsas. In addition, food vendors add spice to the market with cultural cuisine, popular pit beef sandwiches, pastries, cheese, and gourmet treats. The bazaar offers shoppers a variety of unique crafts and collectibles great for gifts or home decor. Handmade items include jewelry, handbags, hair accessories, chairs, rugs, pottery and wooden crafts, stained glass, and artwork such as photographs. The Market is set up underneath the Jones Falls Expressway at Holliday and Saratoga streets

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: First Dogs: Presidential Pets in the White House at Newseum
properties.description: One of the Newseum's most popular exhibits showcases some of the top dogs who have resided at the nation's most prestigious address. On display are images of dogs belonging to 23 presidents, including the newest addition: Bo, a six-month-old Portuguese water dog.

On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Victory Mail at National Museum of American
properties.description: This exhibit showcases the Museum's collection of World War II V-Mail correspondence. V for Victory, a popular symbol of the Second World War, was the inspiration for the name of this new fangled correspondence style.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Perspectives: Hai Bo at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Trained as a painter, Hai Bo, born in 1962 in Changchun, China, took up photography in the 1980s as he became captivated by the camera's ability to stop time and evoke memories. For over two decades, he has been returning to his hometown in Jilin Province to capture the people and places of his youth, creating deeply moving portraits of resilience amidst the growing isolation of rural China. On display are five stunning, large scale photographs from his Northern Series. These images allow viewers to enter the vast panoramas of the artist's childhood memories, observe the subtle changes of nature across seasons, and encounter the gentle transience of life.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: National Treasure Tour at Mount Vernon
properties.description: We have created an entire "National Treasure Tour" where visitors can take an hour-long walking tour that includes behind-the-scenes information about areas where "National Treasure 2: Book of Secrets" filming took place and how these locations were used during George Washington's time, including the basement! These popular tours sell out quickly so please plan ahead! The National Treasure Tours now take place daily through October 31 at 9:30 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:00 p.m.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Resolved at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: 'Resolved' highlights the underlying forensic sciences that have evolved in fulfilling this nation's commitment to the identification and commemoration of the U.S. service member.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Colorforms at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: This selection of artworks from the Hirshhorn's collection, along with several paintings on loan from the National Gallery's renowned Mark Rothko holdings, date from the post-war era to the present and demonstrate color's inimitable capacity to evoke spatial structures as well as more elusive effects.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Yves Klein: With the Void - Full Powers at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: The exhibition will include examples from all of Klein's major series, including his 'Anthropometries,' 'Cosmogonies,' fire paintings, planetary reliefs, and blue monochromes, as well as selections of his lesser-known gold and pink monochromes, body and sponge reliefs, "air architecture," and immaterial works. The installation will also foreground the artist's process and conceptual projects through a range of ephemera, including sketches, photographs, letters, and writings.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Growing Up in Washington at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit features photos and reminiscences that recall museum experiences spanning the past 140 years, featuring memories of childhood visits.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: From A Single Cell at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit documents human development from the embryonic stage to age five and includes real human specimens from the museum's Human Developmental Anatomy Collection (HDAC). It also features anatomical models and images that demonstrate different growth patterns and developmental stages before and after birth.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Research Matters: Environmental and Toxicological Effects of Arsenic at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This exhibit highlights the developing science of medical geology used by the museum's parent organization, the Armed Forces Institute of Pathology, to study health problems associated with exposure to toxic metals and metalloids such as arsenic.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Our Universes: Traditional Knowledge Shapes Our World at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Learn more about indigenous peoples from across the Western Hemisphere who continue to express the wisdom of their ancestors in celebration, language, art, spirituality and daily life.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Art by the Yard: Women Design Mid-Century Britain at Textile Museum
properties.description: Three women designers were pivotal in the artistic revolution in Britain after WWII: Lucienne Day (1917- 2010), Jacqueline Groag (1903-1985) and Marian Mahler (1911-1983). Incorporating dramatic saturated colors and bold motifs inspired by artists like Alexander Calder and Joan Miro, these young designers transformed the market by inspiring elegant yet affordable product lines that brought the world of contemporary art into everyone's homes. On display will be textiles together with preliminary drawings and collages, ceramics and period furniture, all drawn from the Jill A. Wiltse and H. Kirk Brown, III Collection of British Textiles.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: National Treasure Tour at Mount Vernon
properties.description: We have created an entire "National Treasure Tour" where visitors can take an hour-long walking tour that includes behind-the-scenes information about areas where "National Treasure 2: Book of Secrets" filming took place and how these locations were used during George Washington's time, including the basement! These popular tours sell out quickly so please plan ahead! The National Treasure Tours now take place daily through October 31 at 9:30 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:00 p.m.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: First Dogs: Presidential Pets in the White House at Newseum
properties.description: One of the Newseum's most popular exhibits showcases some of the top dogs who have resided at the nation's most prestigious address. On display are images of dogs belonging to 23 presidents, including the newest addition: Bo, a six-month-old Portuguese water dog.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Elvis - His Groundbreaking, Hip-Shaking, Newsmaking Story at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Black Box: Chris Chong Chan Fui at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: Chris Chan Chong Fui, who lives and works in Kuala Lumpur, is the first Malaysian artist to present work at the Hirshhorn.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Bearing Witness: Work by Bradley McCallum & Jacqueline Tarry at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: 'Bearing Witness,' features eight larger-than-life mother-and-child portraits painted on silk and suspended from the ceiling. These portraits are accompanied by audio testimonials from the black teen mothers about their pregnancies and lives following that experience.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Postal Inspectors: the Silent Service at National Museum of American
properties.description: Today about 2,000 postal inspectors are at work across the United States investigating crimes against the mail. By visiting the museum and viewing this exhibit, you'll learn more about the inspectors and what their jobs entail. Sometimes called the silent service, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service is one of the oldest federal law enforcement agencies in the country.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: American Falls: Phil Solomon at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: 'American Falls' is a new multimedia installation by acclaimed experimental filmmaker Phil Solomon, commissioned by the Corcoran for the museum's grand Rotunda.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Winetasting at Boordy Vineyards
properties.description: Boordy Vineyard's wineshop staff will guide you through sampling a portion of Boordy's wines, helping you to find the style that is right for you.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: American Bronzes From the Corcoran Gallery of Art at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: This installation of more than 30 bronze sculptures from the Corcoran's world-renowned collection of American art highlights works dating from the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Sculpture From the Mouse House: the Olga Hirshhorn Collection at the Corcoran at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: From Cypriot, African, and pre-Columbian antiquities to sculpture, paintings, and works on paper by contemporary masters, Olga Hirshhorn has amassed a treasure trove of primarily small and domestic-scale objects. On display at the Corcoran are a selection of three-dimensional works from items she had displayed in her Washington, D.C. home.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Helios: Eadweard Muybridge in A Time of Change at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: Best known for his groundbreaking studies of animal and human locomotion, 19th-century photographer Eadweard Muybridge was also an innovative landscape artist and pioneer of documentary subjects. 'Helios: Eadweard Muybridge in a Time of Change' is the first retrospective exhibition to examine all aspects of Muybridge's art. On display will be numerous vintage photographs, albums, stereographs, lantern slides, glass negatives and positives, camera equipment, patent models, Zoopraxiscope discs, proof prints, notes, books, and other ephemera. Over 300 objects created between 1858 and 1893 are brought together for the first time from numerous international collections. Muybridge's only surviving Zoopraxiscope - an apparatus he designed in 1879 to project motion pictures - will also be on view.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Wine Tastings at Elk Run Vineyards
properties.description: After touring the winery, you are invited to "experience the sumptuous flavors of Maryland" by sampling some of Elk Run's signature wines. For $5, visitors can taste six featured wines of the day. For $8, visitors can taste six wines from the entire list including reserve wines. A commemorative glass can be added for $3. $8.00 to taste 6 wines from our entire list including reserve wines. A commemorative glass can be added for $3.00

The Adobe Creative Suite is a complete design solution that provides today's creative professionals with the tools they need to create and publish content for print and the Web. The CS label is the equivalent of Illustrator 11. Adobe has unified all their applications under the CS name. Please note that CS is the fully functional high-end version of the software. Adobe Illustrator CS4 software is an essential design tool for anyone who needs to express ideas visually in print, on the Web, and in any other medium. This 2-day course provides a thorough overview of the interface, the tools, the features, tricks and tips for using Illustrator CS4. The course is an ideal combination of instructor-led demonstration and hands-on practice. Student Materials: Each participant will receive a copy of Illustrator CS4 Classroom in a Book. Presentation Method: Course lectures are presented by Adobe Certified Instructors. properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Tours at Elk Run Vineyards
properties.description: You are invited to tour the facility, and observe first hand the crush and fermentation process that produce a variety of flavors.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: A Rare Encounter: the Hope and Wittelsbach-Graff Diamonds at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: You are invited to see the world's most extraordinary blue diamonds - the Hope and the Wittelsbach-Graff - displayed together for the first time. The Wittelsbach-Graff's deep blue color, flawless clarity, and royal history make it one of the most celebrated gemstones known. Both diamonds come from India and share their rare blue color. Could they have come from the same mine? Smithsonian scientists plan to compare the properties of both gems and explore this intriguing possibility.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Gods of Angkor: Bronzes From the National Museum of Cambodia at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Revealed through 36 exceptional works on display in the Gallery, the fascinating story of bronze sculpture and casting in Cambodia is revealed. Magnificent examples dating from the prehistoric period to the post-Angkorian period (third century BCE to sixteenth century CE) present the origins, uses, and techniques of bronze casting and the development of a distinctly Cambodian style.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: First Dogs: Presidential Pets in the White House at Newseum
properties.description: One of the Newseum's most popular exhibits showcases some of the top dogs who have resided at the nation's most prestigious address. On display are images of dogs belonging to 23 presidents, including the newest addition: Bo, a six-month-old Portuguese water dog.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Elvis - His Groundbreaking, Hip-Shaking, Newsmaking Story at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Supporting the Force: Navy Supply in Action - Ready for Sea, Ready Ashore at United States Navy Memorial and Naval Heritage Center
properties.description: Navy Supply provides the "beans, bullets and black oil" that enable the US Navy to operate around the globe. Navy Supply touches the lives of every sailor with food, laundry, barbers, postal services and ship's stores. On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Ooey, Gooey, and Wonderful Camp at Battle Creek Cypress Swamp
properties.description: Campers will follow in the muddy footsteps of swamp animals, meet some slimy live creatures up close, and take a close look at fantastic plants. We'll search the habitats around the nature center for animals and plants big and small - and discover how everything fits together in the web of life. Enjoy outdoor adventures supplemented by songs, stories, games, and having fun with new friends.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Plantation Tour at Mount Harmon Plantation
properties.description: Mount Harmon Plantation is open to the public May through October, Thursday through Sunday, 10:00 a.m. ~ 3:00 p.m. Guided tours are conducted on the hour, beginning at 10am, last tour conducted at 2pm. Groups of 8 or more, please call in advance for reservations. We are not open on national holidays.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Nature Nook at Charlotte's Quest Nature Center
properties.description: Led by Miss Sherry, please Join us for stories, crafts, and a hike as we explore the wonders of nature. Please register at least two days in advance.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Weight Loss thru the Magic of Tibetan Singing Bowls at Inspired Journeys
properties.description: Come join Margit Willems for one or all of the fun-filled, informative, and relaxing session, where you will • Receive the positive support and motivation from friends, instead of negative remarks from all the loved ones that actually do more harm than good. • Learn something new about yourself that could be a roadblock to losing weight, instead of getting frustrated why your latest diet attempt did not work, again. • Get the relaxation you need, through a guided meditation with Tibetan Singing Bowls, that will kick start your body into losing weight. • Get tips on how to trick your mind into making the shift towards the “you” you want to be. During each session I will introduce a new activity to support your weight loss, as well as a new guided meditation, which you are allowed to record for personal use between sessions. Cost: $15 per session, or $99 for eight session if paid in full at the end of the second session. Email events@inspiredeventsofmd.com or call 443-396-1282 to register

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Daily Zoo Programs at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Something is always happening at the National Zoo. Daily programs include animal training, feeding demonstrations, and keeper talks. Check the daily schedule when entering the zoo for specific times and locations.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Guided Tours at William Paca House and Garden
properties.description: The William Paca House & Garden is a National Historic Landmark, restored by Historic Annapolis Foundation to its colonial-era splendor. The House is open for docent-led tours for individuals and groups. Tours take place hourly on the half-hour, last approximately 40 minutes, and encompass two floors of 18th-century history. You can take a self-paced tour of the garden at any time during opening hours.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: National Treasure Tour at Mount Vernon
properties.description: We have created an entire "National Treasure Tour" where visitors can take an hour-long walking tour that includes behind-the-scenes information about areas where "National Treasure 2: Book of Secrets" filming took place and how these locations were used during George Washington's time, including the basement! These popular tours sell out quickly so please plan ahead! The National Treasure Tours now take place daily through October 31 at 9:30 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:00 p.m.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Ex Libris: Chester Dale at National Gallery of Art - West Building
properties.description: Held in conjunction with 'From Impressionism to Modernism: The Chester Dale Collection,' this exhibition explores the relationships that Chester (1883-1962) and Maud Dale (1876-1953) had with various contemporary artists.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Rockville Town Square FREE Kids Night at Rockville Town Square Plaza
properties.description: Join us in the plaza at Rockville Town Square and enjoy live children's entertainment at 6:30pm & 7:30pm. The Free Summer Event Series also includes Outdoor Movies on Wednesdays and Concerts on the Square on Thursdays each week through August 5th. properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Concert in the Square at Rockville Town Square Plaza
properties.description: Join us in the plaza at Rockville Town Square and enjoy a Concert in the Square every Thursday Now through August 5th as part of the Free Summer Event Series. properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Gospel Brunch at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: Every Sunday starting June 6th, 2010 join the FoodArts team for a Gospel Brunch at the Corcoran Gallery of Art. Enjoy the southern cuisine as you listen to inspirational classical gospel hymns by Classical Guitarist - Roberto Alcaraz. The Gospel Sunday Brunch centers around an eloquent buffet of hot and cold dishes, including several vegetarian and vegan options. On site Chefs will prepare made to order omelets, scrambled eggs and homemade style waffles. Unlimited glasses of champagne or mimosas, coffee, tea and juices are included. There are two seating's 11:00am and 12:30pm Make your reservations today reservations@foodartsdc.com or 202.812.2787

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: A Century of Design: the US Commission of Fine Arts, 1910-2010 at National Building Museum
properties.description: Established 100 years ago, the CFA advises the President and Congress on the design of the National Capital and our national symbols. This exhibition will explore how this design-focused federal agency has shaped the city, from memorials that commemorate our history and define our national identity to the public parks and projects that enhance the city and help make it a desirable place to live, work, and play.

properties.description: Clearwater Nature center offers a variety of day camps this summer. From Wetland Wanderers to Junior Naturalist, Clearwater camps are tons of fun. Visit www.pgparks.com for more info.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Intersections Art Projects - Regi Muller at The Phillips Collection
properties.description: This spring Regi Muller transform the museum's Vradenburg Cafe by installing hundreds of peach-colored urethane Caps on its walls and windows. Trained as a textile and graphic designer, Muller lives in New York City. She is the winner of numerous awards and honors and has exhibited in her native Switzerland, as well as in the United States.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Intersections Art Projects - Kate Shepherd: Relation to and Yet Not (Homage to Mondrian) at The Phillips Collection
properties.description: Kate Shepherd is best known for large, vertical, mostly monochrome paintings in hi-gloss enamel on wooden panels. Using intense colors, delicate lines, and multiple perspectives, she suggests structures and patterns - wallpaper, steps, lace, a cage, for example - that create illusionary three-dimensional space. Her work in the former dining room of the Phillips house incorporates painting and sculpture and focuses on architectural details.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Robert Ryman: Variations & Improvisations at The Phillips Collection
properties.description: Robert Ryman (b. 1930) is an American painter best known for abstract, white-on-white paintings. This exhibition presents Ryman's ongoing examination of painting as both medium and process with endless variations in materials and methods. It brings together approximately 25 small-scale paintings that are drawn from private collections, some of which have rarely been shown in the U.S. It is the first solo presentation of Ryman's work in the Washington area.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: American Modernism: the Shein Collection at National Gallery of Art - West Building
properties.description: On display are 20 important paintings, sculptures, and drawings by the first-generation American avant-garde. Among the artists represented in this exhibit are Patrick Henry Bruce, Stuart Davis, Charles Demuth, Arthur Dove, Marcel Duchamp, Marsden Hartley, Stanton Macdonald-Wright, John Marin, Georgia O'Keeffe, Man Ray, Morton Schamberg, Charles Sheeler, Joseph Stella, John Storrs and Max Weber. All works are from the Edward and Deborah Shein Collection, which is distinguished by its remarkable quality and rigorous focus on early American modernism.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: American Modernism: the Shein Collection at National Gallery of Art - West Building
properties.description: On display are 20 important paintings, sculptures, and drawings by the first-generation American avant-garde. Among the artists represented in this exhibit are Patrick Henry Bruce, Stuart Davis, Charles Demuth, Arthur Dove, Marcel Duchamp, Marsden Hartley, Stanton Macdonald-Wright, John Marin, Georgia O'Keeffe, Man Ray, Morton Schamberg, Charles Sheeler, Joseph Stella, John Storrs and Max Weber. properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Beat Memories: the Photographs of Allen Ginsberg at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: Some 79 works on display will range from the 1950s "drugstore" prints to his now celebrated portraits of Jack Kerouac and William S. Burroughs, snapshots of Ginsberg himself taken just before he achieved literary fame, and his later portraits of the Beats and other friends made in the 1980s and 1990s.

properties.description: This exhibit explores the different realms of flute-playing, from the lively to the serene, and takes an etymological and iconographic journey through the depth and breadth of the Library of Congress collections relating to the flute.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Luminous Warrior Mini-Healings in ChinaTown at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description:
Do you need a BREAK from work?
Would you like a quick energy BOOST?
Would you like to EXPERIENCE Shamanic Healing?
If the answer is YES, then come on out to the Art Museum! Sara will be offering FREE Luminous Warrior mini-healings this summer to give you the boost YOU need to continue your day.
What can I expect?
When you arrive, Sara will welcome you and ask how you are feeling. You will have the option to remain seated on the blanket or lie down on your back to receive the healing. Sara will use Shamanic guidance to provide a combination of energy balancing, hands-on healing methods, Chakra cleansing techniques, essential oils and affirmations to facilitate the healing. If you are open to it, Sara may also provide messages that she receives from Spirit so that you can reconnect with your own authentic self. You will return to work balanced, peaceful, alert and refreshed.
When and Where?
Luminous Warrior Mini-Healings will take place EVERY MONDAY from 12pm-2pm, beginning June 21 and ending July 19. Find Sara at the American Art Museum in Chinatown. She will be sitting on a blanket at the indoor glass- ceiling courtyard, across the café.
What does it cost?
It’s FREE! If you feel the urge to provide something in reciprocity, feel free to bring a donation or small gift (flower, stone...). There is NO need to register.
Why is this being offered?
Sara would like to introduce you to Luminous Warrior. She also believes in the principle of Ayni, a Quechua word meaning reciprocity. This is her way of giving to her community. Simply come out and allow yourself to receive!

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Wizards Basketball Camps at Verizon Center
properties.description: With appearances from current and former Washington Wizards and Bullets coaches and players, as well as other athletes, NBA and WNBA stars, Wizards Basketball Camps provide boys and girls ages 8-17 with a professional basketball learning experience. By instilling the importance of commitment, teamwork and character - skills that will take players far both on and off the court - Wizards Basketball Camps allow young basketball players to train with the pros in basketball fundamentals, strategies and drills.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Miniature Train at Wheaton Regional Park
properties.description: The miniature train at Wheaton Regional Park is a replica of the 1863 C.P. Huntington, a 4-2-4T steam locomotive purchased by the Southern Pacific Railroad and named in honor of Collis P. Huntington, President of the Southern Pacific Company. Passengers depart the train station for a 10-minute tour of the park's forests and meadows, over a trestle bridge, and past Pine Lake.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Ovid Hazen Wells Carousel at Wheaton Regional Park
properties.description: The Ovid Hazen Wells Carousel was built by the Herschell Spillman Company of Tonawanda, NY in 1915. It features 33 jumping horses, three zebras and two chariots, making it a mixture of Herschell-Spillman (circa 1905-1915), Spillman Engineering (circa 1920) and Allen Herschel (circa 1920) carvings.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Screen on the Green Film Festival at The National Mall
properties.description: Screen on the Green is a favorite Washington, DC summer tradition. Films are shown on Monday nights beginning at dusk, around 8:30 pm-9 pm. Plan on arriving early, as people start to claim their spots on the lawn as early as 5 pm. So, bring your blankets, sit back, relax, and enjoy the show.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: BUMPA - Baltimore Users of Mobile Phones by Apple/Android at Wegman's Hunt Valley
properties.description: Sharing the Best Apps and other exciting uses and developments in the world of iPhone's, iPad's & iPod's. Accelerate your learning curve and network with other early adopters and dynamic users of this rapidly advancing technology. For more info contact: Bruce Marshall @ (410)329-1200 or email: brucesiphone@yahoo.com

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Lux Lounge Friday (Free til 12 w/ RSVP to Scott@Suite202DC.com) at Lux Lounge
properties.description: Join Suite 202 , the evenings host Taz Wube at LUX Lounge this Friday. Be sure to join me on the 2nd floor as I give away FREE Ciroc Shots to help get the party started. To RSVP for complimentary before 12 MIDNIGHT FREE ENTRY e-mail all FIRST & LAST name additions as well as a e-mail address for each guest to: Scott@Suite202DC.com by 6:00 PM each and every Friday. Please include "LUX" as your subject.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Online Marketing Summit- Washington, D.C. at National Press Club
properties.description: The Online Marketing Summit (OMS) is coming to Washington, D.C. on July 12! This is your chance to learn best practices and actionable strategies from the nation's best online marketing professionals and practitioners. Connect with hundreds of your local marketing peers to learn, network and share ideas. Join us for NEW B2B and B2C case studies and social media integration tracks, unparalleled networking opportunities, and an exclusive Social Media and Content Marketing Workshop and Breakfast, brought to you by the Online Marketing Institute and the Wharton Interactive Media Initiative. Register today at http://bit.ly/aEEbzE. Ticket Info: Full-Day Pass: $369, Social Media Workshop and Breakfast: $99

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Karuna II: Cost: $150 presented by Amanda Sachs at Inspired Journeys
properties.description: In these classes presented by Amanda Sachs participants learn the symbols from Karuna I and II and practice using them in a session. These symbols heal on the cellular level, heal the shadow self, heal addictions, and develop compassionate action, to name only a few of their attributes. These symbols also help in grounding the aura and connecting you with the ascended beings and the angelic kingdom. In each class you will receive a Karuna attunement. Karuna brings resolution to emotional issues quickly. It integrates well with the USUI Reiki tools and energy. It helps to calm and ground clients so that they can relax more quickly. It is very powerful. CE hours are provided for massage therapists and social workers. Email Events@InspiredJourneys.com to register Call 443-396-1282 for more information.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: Nage Bistro Offers Special Red Fish Sandwich Fundraiser to Benefit Gulf Coast Relief Efforts at Nage Bistro
properties.description:
From now until January 2011, Gulf Coast native and executive chef at Nage Bistro, Glenn Babcock will offer a special red fish sandwich for $10, with all profits benefitting Gulf Coast relief, specifically to support fishermen, shrimpers and oystermen whose livelihoods are threatened by the oil spill.
The Gulf Coast Red Fish Sandwich is prepared in traditional Gulf Coast fashion and features a filet of buttery, mild red fish which is blackened and topped with lemon caper aioli. It is served on a house made ciabatta roll with lettuce and tomato and comes with a side of green cabbage slaw.

properties.title: Jul 11, 2010: Microsoft Worldwide Partner Conference at Walter E. Washington Convention Center
properties.description: Join IDV in Washington, DC, at the Microsoft Worldwide Partner Conference (WPC), an annual gathering for the Microsoft partner community to learn about Microsoft’s roadmap for the upcoming year, network and build connections, share best practices, experience the latest product innovations and learn new skills and techniques.

properties.title: Jul  9, 2010: CycleLife Free Rides During Georgetown Healthy Days of Summer at CycleLife
properties.description:
CycleLife hosts a free 'beginner's ride' every Friday at noon and a free 'DC Velo' fast group bike ride every Saturday from 7 to 9 a.m. They also host a power lunch boot camp every Monday and Wednesday where the first class is free.
Georgetown Healthy Days of Summer
Throughout the month of July, Georgetown, D.C. will host "Healthy Days of Summer 2010," a healthy living promotion showcasing the neighborhood's variety of outdoor activities, numerous fitness-minded merchants and healthy dining options. Georgetown will play host to several creative health initiatives throughout the month ranging from outdoor yoga classes to free group bike rides to encourage a life of wellness and make healthy living fun, easy, and accessible.
Georgetown's "Healthy Days of Summer" month aims to promote healthy living by providing residents with exciting hosted physical activities, and healthy menu options at area restaurants, while highlighting the neighborhood's various places to keep active on a regular basis.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Mason Dixon Master Chef Tournament at The Belvedere Hotel
properties.description: Baltimore's own Iron Chef- head to head battle between 32 local teams, each consisting of an executive chef and a sous chef. A panel of judges, including industry experts, local celebrities, and audience members will determine the winning teams. 10% of the net proceeds from ticket sales go to Moveable Feast. Moveable Feast is a local non-profit charity that provides meal delivery service to homebound People Living with AIDS/HIV and women undergoing breast cancer. Includes 4 course meal.
