properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Summer Nature Camps at Green Spring Gardens
properties.description: Choose from a variety of camps at the Green Springs Garden park this summer. Camps vary from themes like, "Where the Wild Things Grow: Garden Camp" and "Arts al Fresco". Dates and age groups vary. Check online at www.farifaxcounty.gov for more details.

properties.title: Jul 12, 2010: Summer Camps at Meadowside Nature Center
properties.description: Summer camps feature lively hands-on activities, games, nature walks, and crafts. MNC offers both partial and full-day camps to meet the needs of you and your child. Each week starts a new adventure. Come and be part of the fun!

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Beyond: Visions of Our Solar System at National Air and Space Museum
properties.description: 'Beyond: Visions of Our Solar System,' an exhibition of 148 brilliant color and black-and-white photographs - images from space captured by unmanned interplanetary probes - will be on display at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum. In addition, works by artist Michael Benson, which combine art, science and photography, will be on view in the second-floor Art Gallery. The exhibition is the result of Benson's research in the archives of NASA, the European Space Agency and other sources of space photographs. The artist processed and combined the images to create large-format composite views of planets and moons. Photos in the exhibition cover objects from the entire solar system.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Washington Monument Tours at Washington Monument
properties.description: The Washington Monument, built at intervals between 1848 and 1885 with funds from public subscriptions and Federal appropriations, memorializes George Washington's achievements and unselfish devotion to principle and to country. It shows the gratitude of the people of the United States to the father of their country and their living faith in the causes for which he stood.

properties.title: Jul 13, 2010: Croydon Creek Nature Camps at Croydon Creek Nature Center
properties.description: Join us at Croydon Creek Nature Center for our summer camps! We have lots of camp for various age groups and dates. Check www.rockvillemd.gov/recreation for more details.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Backyard Theater: Hip Hop Flip Flop with CityDance at Strathmore
properties.description:
Kids Under 3 Are Free!
Dancers from the CityDance Conservatory at Strathmore will lead the audience through a high-energy dance program that traces the development of hip hop steps through a variety of genres including Jazz, Afro-modern, Break Dance and Bollywood.
Parking: Parking for Backyard Theater is in the Mansion lot on a space available basis. Enter the lot at 10701 Rockville Pike. Overflow parking is at the meters along Tuckerman Lane, or in the Metro garage ($4.75 Metro SmarTrip card required to pay the fare).
Seating: The Backyard Theater stage is located under a tent. Please bring blankets or low beach chairs. No pets, please.

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Laura Ingraham, "The Obama Diaries" at Talk Radio Network, America's Morning News
properties.description: See Laura Ingraham on tour to promote "The Obama Diaries"

properties.title: Jul 15, 2010: Locust Grove Day Camps at Locust Grove Nature Center
properties.description: Summer's on its way! Locust Grove Nature Center's camps are designed to fit a parent's busy schedule and keep a camper excited about being outside all summer long. All camps include Naturalist-lead activities, hikes, crafts, and games designed to inspire and foster a love for nature. Register for up to six weeks of concurrent camp sessions for children entering grades 1-3 and/or grades 4-6. Camp sessions run Monday through Friday from 9 3:30, and after care is available for an additional fee.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Intuitive Development Class with Melissa Feick at Inspired Journeys
properties.description: We will methodically work and teach you a PROVEN method for opening up your intuitive, psychic abilities and centers. You will easily and effortlessly communicate with the Angels, Guides and Masters. This workshop is run by Melissa Feick, Angel Therapy Practitioner certified by Doreen Virtue, PhD. -Learn about the 5th plane where the Angels and Ascended Masters Live -Experience an affective meditation to connect you with the fifth plane -Heighten your intuition quickly and effortlessly -Meet your guides -Learn the secret to giving others and yourself great intuitive readings -Receive group healings to remove blocks from your intuitive abilities -Auras, chakras, healing -Practice readings with other intuitives -Learn to and Practice talking to deceased loved ones in a supportive, safe environment By coming to this class weekly you will feel confident in your intuitive ability. You will have opened up your intuitive centers and visited the planes of the Angels, Masters and guides. This class is for newbie's and the most experienced intuitive. We look forward to learning and playing together! Tonight Goddess Work Call 443-396-1282 or email events@InspiredJourneys.com to register.

properties.title: Jul 30, 2010: Acoustic Soul at Indulj
properties.description:
Every Wednesday and Friday, from 7-10PM, slow things down for a unique fine dining experience in the heart of the city. While enjoying the soothing sounds of CoolFire's acoustic R&B music, sample Indulj's many delectable tapas and savory entrees in a quaint and classy atmosphere, minus the loud music and rowdy crowd found in many area bars and lounges. After a hard day at work, CoolFire’s mellow vibe provides the perfect back...drop for a relaxing and pleasing dinner. Check out this week’s featured items:
Santos Wings - grilled then baked with a zesty seasoning blend
Jerk Wings - grilled then baked in an authentic Jamaican jerk sauce
Down Home Spring Rolls - fusion at it’s best! Indulj’s signature collard greends, yellow rice deep-fried in a crispy wonton wrapper
Skewer Trio - salmon, beef & chicken skewers served over yellow rice
Lousiana Catfish Nuggets - crispy fried catfish nuggets served with homemade Remoulade Sauce
Seafood Lingiuni - clams, calamari, shrimp and scallops in a spicy tomato sauce
Grilled Salmon - with roasted potatoes and sautéed spinach
Arborio Rice - with shrimp and shitake mushrooms
____________________________________________________
Admission: FREE
Crowd: 30+ and up
Dress: Casual/Business casual
Atmosphere: Relaxing, candlelit tables, conversation-friendly
Music: CoolFire's acoustic R&B set features 2 guitar players, and covers the music of Marvin Gaye, Donny Hathaway, Stevie Wonder, Luther Vandross, Maxwell, Sade, Jill Scott, Erykah Badu, Ledisi, and many more!
Perfect for: “Date Night”, Married Couples, Girls Night Out, First Dates, Casual Business meetings, Pre-nightclub dinner, Birthday Dinners and celebrations, post-workout meal - shower required :), and “I don’t feel like cooking” Nights!
Indulj Lounge
1208 U Street, NW
Washington DC 20009
(across from Ben's Chili Bowl)
To reserve a table visit www.opentable.com or call 202-986-9400 and mention CoolFire. For more info on CoolFire visit www.coolfiresoul.com

After a hard day at work, CoolFire’s mellow vibe provides the perfect back...drop for a relaxing and pleasing dinner. Check out this week’s featured items:
Santos Wings - grilled then baked with a zesty seasoning blend
Jerk Wings - grilled then baked in an authentic Jamaican jerk sauce
Down Home Spring Rolls - fusion at it’s best! Indulj’s signature collard greends, yellow rice deep-fried in a crispy wonton wrapper
Skewer Trio - salmon, beef & chicken skewers served over yellow rice
Lousiana Catfish Nuggets - crispy fried catfish nuggets served with homemade Remoulade Sauce
Seafood Lingiuni - clams, calamari, shrimp and scallops in a spicy tomato sauce
Grilled Salmon - with roasted potatoes and sautéed spinach
Arborio Rice - with shrimp and shitake mushrooms
____________________________________________________
Admission: FREE
Crowd: 30+ and up
Dress: Casual/Business casual
Atmosphere: Relaxing, candlelit tables, conversation-friendly
Music: CoolFire's acoustic R&B set features 2 guitar players, and covers the music of Marvin Gaye, Donny Hathaway, Stevie Wonder, Luther Vandross, Maxwell, Sade, Jill Scott, Erykah Badu, Ledisi, and many more!
Perfect for: “Date Night”, Married Couples, Girls Night Out, First Dates, Casual Business meetings, Pre-nightclub dinner, Birthday Dinners and celebrations, post-workout meal - shower required :), and “I don’t feel like cooking” Nights!
Indulj Lounge
1208 U Street, NW
Washington DC 20009
(across from Ben's Chili Bowl)
To reserve a table visit www.opentable.com or call 202-986-9400 and mention CoolFire. For more info on CoolFire visit www.coolfiresoul.com

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Halls of Fame Design House at The Washington Design Center
properties.description: The Design House, newly rebuilt on the 5th floor of The Washington Design Center, provides lifestyle-conscious consumers an entree into the world of high-end home decor. The 2010 Design House will truly celebrate local designers, with each room in the house designed by a WDC Hall of Fame Designer.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Editors' Picks: the Best of Smithsonian Magazine's 7th Annual Photo Contest at Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: For its 7th annual photo contest, Smithsonian magazine received over 45,000 entries from the United States and around the world in the following five categories: Altered Images, Americana, The Natural World, People, and Travel. A panel of judges selected 50 finalists, 30 of which will be displayed in the Castle.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Yves Klein: With the Void - Full Powers at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: The exhibition will include examples from all of Klein's major series, including his 'Anthropometries,' 'Cosmogonies,' fire paintings, planetary reliefs, and blue monochromes, as well as selections of his lesser-known gold and pink monochromes, body and sponge reliefs, "air architecture," and immaterial works. The installation will also foreground the artist's process and conceptual projects through a range of ephemera, including sketches, photographs, letters, and writings.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Wine Tastings at Elk Run Vineyards
properties.description: You are invited to tour the facility, and observe first hand the crush and fermentation process that produce a variety of flavors.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Hans Hofmann: Circa 1950 at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: The Natural History Building first opened its doors to the public on March 17, 1910. The Museum celebrates its 100th birthday with a special exhibition featuring archival and modern photographs highlighting many facets of this building - its people, collections, exhibitions, and outreach throughout the years. Photographs both old and new give snapshots of life and work at the Museum over the past 100 years.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Ballet Folklorico at Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
properties.description: 'Brave New World I' is a compelling video installation played on a television screen fitted within a four-sided mirror box with a false front at the opposite end. Appearing like a gold-framed painting hanging on a wall, the artwork invites viewers to look inside to see reflections of themselves watching moving images repeatedly reflected in a spherical form.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: The Shoe Must Go On! at Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
properties.description: By tracing the story of the beautiful coiled basket, 'Grass Roots' will revisit the history of the southeastern United States and will demonstrate the enduring contribution of African peoples and cultures to American life.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: ON! the Beginnings of the Electric Sound Generation at Newseum
properties.description: More than 700 newspapers transmit their front pages electronically to the Newseum every day. Up to 80 are enlarged and printed for display in this gallery - among them one from every state and the District of Columbia as well as a sampling of international newspapers. Additional front pages are displayed outside the Newseum on Pennsylvania Avenue.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Guillermo Kuitca: Everything - Paintings and Works on Paper, 1980-2008 at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: On display are 20 important paintings, sculptures, and drawings by the first-generation American avant-garde. Among the artists represented in this exhibit are Patrick Henry Bruce, Stuart Davis, Charles Demuth, Arthur Dove, Marcel Duchamp, Marsden Hartley, Stanton Macdonald-Wright, John Marin, Georgia O'Keeffe, Man Ray, Morton Schamberg, Charles Sheeler, Joseph Stella, John Storrs and Max Weber. All works are from the Edward and Deborah Shein Collection, which is distinguished by its remarkable quality and rigorous focus on early American modernism.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Walker Open Field at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: The central ideas and accomplishments of Norwegian artist Edvard Munch (1863-1944) are illuminated in an exhibition that brings together sixty of his rare color prints and hand-colored variations of these prints.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: On the Road at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: Some 79 works on display will range from the 1950s "drugstore" prints to his now celebrated portraits of Jack Kerouac and William S. Burroughs, snapshots of Ginsberg himself taken just before he achieved literary fame, and his later portraits of the Beats and other friends made in the 1980s and 1990s.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Ice Age Arizona: Preserving the Naco Mammoth at Newseum
properties.description: One of the Newseum's most popular exhibits showcases some of the top dogs who have resided at the nation's most prestigious address. On display are images of dogs belonging to 23 presidents, including the newest addition: Bo, a six-month-old Portuguese water dog.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Thursday Music Cruise at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: LSU: Past and Present at United States Navy Memorial and Naval Heritage Center
properties.description: Navy Supply provides the "beans, bullets and black oil" that enable the US Navy to operate around the globe. Navy Supply touches the lives of every sailor with food, laundry, barbers, postal services and ship's stores. On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: New Britain Rock Cats at Reading Phillies at Boordy Vineyards
properties.description: Boordy Vineyard's wineshop staff will guide you through sampling a portion of Boordy's wines, helping you to find the style that is right for you.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: National Treasure Tour at Mount Vernon
properties.description: We have created an entire "National Treasure Tour" where visitors can take an hour-long walking tour that includes behind-the-scenes information about areas where "National Treasure 2: Book of Secrets" filming took place and how these locations were used during George Washington's time, including the basement! These popular tours sell out quickly so please plan ahead! The National Treasure Tours now take place daily through October 31 at 9:30 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:00 p.m.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Washington Monument Tours at Washington Monument
properties.description: The Washington Monument, built at intervals between 1848 and 1885 with funds from public subscriptions and Federal appropriations, memorializes George Washington's achievements and unselfish devotion to principle and to country. It shows the gratitude of the people of the United States to the father of their country and their living faith in the causes for which he stood.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Losing Paradise: Endangered Plants Here and Around the World at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Explore the beauty and diversity of the world's endangered plants through forty-five works of art by member artists of the American Society of Botanical Artists. Learn about the Museum's efforts to help plant conservationists determine which plant species are threatened. Find out how botanical illustration supports the scientific work of the Museum's Botany Department.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Free, Tips-Only Walking Tour of Washington DC at Walk of the Town
properties.description: Our nation’s capital is full of magnificent sites, memorials, monuments and museums that are bursting with American history and secrets. Let superb storyteller, history buff, schoolteacher and licensed DC professional tour guide Tim lead you on an exciting, educational and interactive tour of his native city. The best part – it’s a FREE, tips-only tour.  Check out the Web site for more specific information about where to meet for the tour, and where each tour goes!

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Colorforms at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: This selection of artworks from the Hirshhorn's collection, along with several paintings on loan from the National Gallery's renowned Mark Rothko holdings, date from the post-war era to the present and demonstrate color's inimitable capacity to evoke spatial structures as well as more elusive effects.

properties.title: Aug 31, 2010: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Monday Night Trivia at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Using artifacts, rare photographs, and ephemera to explore the origins and religious practices of the movement in Jamaica, this exhibition takes viewers beyond the popular Jamaican music known as reggae to the deeper roots of the Rastafari culture. Video footage featuring first-person testimony from male and female Rastafari of different ages, nationalities, and racial and class backgrounds speak to Rastafari of unity and to the spread of the movement across the Caribbean and beyond over the past three decades.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: The Congress at The Phillips Collection

She is the winner of numerous awards and honors and has exhibited in her native Switzerland, as well as in the United States.

properties.title: Sep 15, 2010: Checkmate - Medieval People at Play at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: Neither stodgy nor perpetually pious, medieval people found time for amusement in the margins of their lives and their manuscripts. From peasant boys shirking their winter duties in order to lob snowballs at each other to monkeys gleefully dancing to "Ring around the Rosie," their antics have come down to us in art. This exhibit explores a sense of whimsy and fun that is uniquely medieval yet remarkably relevant to us today.

properties.title: Jan  9, 2011: 24th CMC Strategy Forum: A Practical Approach to the Analysis and Immunogenic Potential of Aggregates and Particles at Renaissance Mayflower Hotel

properties.title: Jan  9, 2011: Hebrew Immigrant Aid Society Advocacy Mission at Washington D.C.
properties.description: Join young leaders from around the country for this year’s HIAS Advocacy Mission in Washington, DC from January 9th to 11th, 2011. As a Mission participant, you will have the chance to advocate on behalf of immigrants and refugees, promote awareness about why immigration issues are of particular importance to the Jewish community, attend high-level meetings with government officials from Congress and the Administration, and network with HIAS colleagues and Board Members at a cocktail reception. If you live in the DC area, the price is $95.00, which includes all meetings, most meals, supplies, and local transportation. Limited subsidies available. Register by December 15th! Please contact liza.lieberman@hias.org with any questions.

properties.title: Jan  9, 2011: Zumba in Gaithersburg! at ProFIT Club
properties.description: Zumba, Yoga, Pilates, Kickboxing and more! $7 per class no contracts 304 E Diamond Ave. Gaithersburg, MD 20877http://profitclubmd.com/ 301-602-8142

properties.title: Jan  9, 2011: Open Studio With Chris Engnoth at Mindful Hands
properties.description: Watch art as it happens with Chris Engnoth (www.cengnoth.com), watercolorist and artist-in-residence at Mindful Hands. Chris will be painting, and available to answer your questions or just talk about art. Free and open to the public, no art experience necessary.

properties.title: Jan  9, 2011: Meditation at Mindful Hands
properties.description: Join PCD-DC Center for Tibetan Buddhism (www.palyuldc.org) every Sunday for an introduction to Tibetan Buddhism with silent sitting meditation, visualization, and chanting.  Beginners welcome!  Free, donations gratefully accepted.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Great Ape Research Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Meet a cognitive researcher and learn about studies being conducted with the Zoo's orangutans and gorillas.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Winter Waterbird Survey at Jug Bay Wetlands Sanctuary
properties.description: Enjoy the winter beauty of early an winter morning on the Patuxent while counting waterbirds: Canada geese, harriers, eagles, herons, and many different kinds of ducks. Dress for the weather and wear comfortable walking shoes. Bring binoculars & a field guide if you have them, also available to borrow. For adults. No experience necessary. Call 410-741-9330 to register.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: The Wonder of Light: Touch and Learn at Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: On view in a case are objects from the museums' collections related to light, accompanied by a touch-screen table nearby featuring interactive activities for children that tell stories of light. The name of this exhibition is from the theme of the original Children's Room, "Knowledge begins with Wonder."

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Editors' Picks: the Best of Smithsonian Magazine's 7th Annual Photo Contest at Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: For its 7th annual photo contest, Smithsonian magazine received over 45,000 entries from the United States and around the world in the following five categories: Altered Images, Americana, The Natural World, People, and Travel. A panel of judges selected 50 finalists, 30 of which will be displayed in the Castle.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Homeschool Program at Eden Mill Nature Center
properties.description: Eden Mill Nature Center offers homeschool sessions on Monday mornings. Each session lasts for 3 Mondays of each month (September- May). Parents do not attend the classes with their child but are welcome to visit the nature center, hike the trails, or enjoy the park! PRE-REGISTRATION REQUIRED.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Nature Tots at Anita C Leight Estuary Center
properties.description: Explore and discover the natural world around us during the winter season through sensory activities, songs, movement and a short hike.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Supporting the Force: Navy Supply in Action - Ready for Sea, Ready Ashore at United States Navy Memorial and Naval Heritage Center
properties.description: Navy Supply provides the "beans, bullets and black oil" that enable the US Navy to operate around the globe. Navy Supply touches the lives of every sailor with food, laundry, barbers, postal services and ship's stores. On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: A True North Britain - the Furniture of John Shearer, 1790-1820 at DAR Museum
properties.description: Noted not only for its form but also for the politically charged symbols inlaid in many pieces, the furniture created by John Shearer helps to explore early America's cultural ties to Great Britain during the most contentious period in the two nations' shared history.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Homeschool Program at Eden Mill Nature Center
properties.description: Eden Mill Nature Center offers homeschool sessions on Monday mornings. Each session lasts for 3 Mondays of each month (September- May). Parents do not attend the classes with their child but are welcome to visit the nature center, hike the trails, or enjoy the park! PRE-REGISTRATION REQUIRED.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Covering Katrina at Newseum
properties.description: 'Covering Katrina' chronicles the dramatic tale of the media's reporting of the killer storm that struck the Gulf Coast. Never-before-displayed artifacts illustrate the professional challenges and personal losses reporters suffered covering the storm and the sometimes perilous conditions they faced. The exhibit also includes an original Newseum-produced video that features dramatic footage of storm coverage along with vivid and often emotional first-person accounts from newspaper editors and TV journalists who balanced objective reporting with their own personal frustrations.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Visionary Distillations at American Center for Physics
properties.description: 'Visionary Distillations' brings together the photographs of Robert Cassanova, the paintings of Kim Dylla and the sculptures of Minna Newman Nathanson. While their mediums differ, they each seek out the unexpected, and using their imagination, essentialize form to reveal fundamental patterns and connections.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Tours of the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House at Mary Mc Leod Bethune Council
properties.description: Mary McLeod Bethune achieved her greatest national and international recognition at the Washington, DC townhouse at 1318 Vermont Avenue, NW, that is now this Historic Site. It was the first headquarters of the National Council of Negro Women (NCNW) and was her last home in Washington, DC. From here, Bethune and the Council spearheaded strategies and developed programs that advanced the interests of African American women and the Black community.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Elvis - His Groundbreaking, Hip-Shaking, Newsmaking Story at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Gods of Angkor: Bronzes From the National Museum of Cambodia at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Revealed through 36 exceptional works on display in the Gallery, the fascinating story of bronze sculpture and casting in Cambodia is revealed. Magnificent examples dating from the prehistoric period to the post-Angkorian period (third century BCE to sixteenth century CE) present the origins, uses, and techniques of bronze casting and the development of a distinctly Cambodian style.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Small Mammal House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about a wide variety of mammals, including the three-banded armadillo, naked mole-rat, golden lion tamarin, and banded mongoose.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Primate Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about some of our closest relatives, great and lesser apes - gorillas, orangutans and gibbons - and discuss the idea of animal thinking.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Kids' Farm Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about farming and how taking care of animals takes time, dedication, and knowledge.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Theo Eshetu: Brave New World at Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
properties.description: In this exhibit, Theo Eshetu explores such universal tensions as the relationship between nature and technology and the idea of life as a spectacle. He does so with images that map his personal geography: scenes from a dance performance he filmed at a restaurant in Bali, footage from visits to New York City and Ethiopia, and even a cameo appearance by a box of Kellogg's corn flakes. He collaborated with musician and sound designer Keir Fraser to produce the video's seductive and meditative soundtrack.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Invertebrate House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Explore the complex, fascinating world of invertebrates: corals and crabs, ants and anemones, seashells and spiders. Feeding demonstrations take place every half-hour. Hands-on activities vary daily.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Chinamania at Freer Gallery of Art
properties.description: Blue-and-white Chinese porcelain became a hot item in London in the 1870s, a craze the British press mockingly dubbed "Chinamania." James McNeill Whistler, an early collector of Chinese porcelain, helped stimulate this fad by depicting such wares in his paintings. The Chinamania exhibition at the Freer explores Chinese porcelain in Whistler's England, where it was first valued as aesthetic inspiration but soon proliferated as a commodity. Featured are twenty-three works of art: blue-and-white porcelain objects from the Peacock Room; eight wash drawings of Kangxi porcelain that Whistler produced for a collector's catalogue; and paintings, pastels, and etchings inspired by the artist's interest in porcelain.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: The Art of Gaman: Arts and Crafts From the Japanese American Internment Camps, 1942-1946 at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: This exhibit will showcase arts and crafts made by Japanese Americans in U.S. internment camps during World War II. On display will be more than 100 objects, many of which are on loan from former internees or their families. The exhibition is based on Delphine Hirasuna's 2005 book 'The Art of Gaman.'

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Fiona Tan: Rise and Fall at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: This exhibition of photographs and videos by Fiona Tan, born in Indonesia in 1966 and now living in Amsterdam, is the first major presentation of her work in the United States. Tan's installations deftly meld the past with the present in profoundly evocative works that explore the power of images in constructing memories and histories. Whether drawing on old photographs, seventeenth-century Dutch painting, or nineteenth-century orientalist architecture, her conceptual and aesthetic approach adds a compelling dimension to understanding Asian art and culture in the world today.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Postal Inspectors: the Silent Service at National Postal Museum
properties.description: Today about 2,000 postal inspectors are at work across the United States investigating crimes against the mail. By visiting the museum and viewing this exhibit, you'll learn more about the inspectors and what their jobs entail. Sometimes called the silent service, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service is one of the oldest federal law enforcement agencies in the country.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Great Cats Viewing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: You are invited to visit with the zoo's lions and tigers.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Designing Tomorrow: America's World's Fairs of the 1930s at National Building Museum
properties.description: A first-of-its-kind exhibition, 'Designing Tomorrow' will feature nearly 200 never-before-assembled artifacts including building models, architectural remnants, drawings, paintings, prints, furniture, an original RCA TRK-12 television, Elektro the Moto-Man robot, and period film footage.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Elephant Viewing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: The Elephant House will be closed while a new home is built for the elephants. However, they will be on view in their outdoor habitats daily (weather dependent).

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Investigating Where We Live at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibition presents students' interpretations of D.C. neighborhoods through photography, writing, and original artwork. This year's participants explored Petworth, Trinidad, and the Southwest Waterfront in Washington, D.C.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: LEGO Architecture: Towering Ambition at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibit features 15 LEGO models built by LEGO certified professional Adam Reed Tucker. The buildings and structures that Tucker has assembled are some of the most recognizable works of architecture in the world, including: the Empire State Building, the World Trade Center, Trump Tower, the St. Louis Arch, and the Burj Khalfia.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Asia Trail Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about giant pandas, sloth bears, clouded leopards, and four other species living on Asia Trail.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Cheetah Conservation Station Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Explore the world of the cheetah and other animals at the Cheetah Conservation Station, including Grevy's zebra and scimitar-horned oryx.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: The Body Inside and Out: Anatomical Literature and Art Theory Selections From the National Gallery of Art Library at National Gallery of Art - East Building
Jan 10, 2011: The Hyperbolic Crochet Coral Reef at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: The hyperbolic crochet coral reef has grown from the discovery that cutting-edge hyperbolic geometry could be found in the intricate structures of coral reefs and represented though the traditional handicraft of crochet. Experience this homage to the disappearing wonder, beauty, and diversity of living reefs that are threatened by pollution and global warming.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Cyprus: Crossroads of Civilizations at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Located in the eastern Mediterranean Sea, the island of Cyprus has been a crossroads of civilizations for over 11,000 years. Explore the history of Cyprus through a rich collection of antiquities, most of which are traveling outside the country for the first time. Discover the ways in which the human endeavor has shaped and is shaped by the natural environment of this Mediterranean jewel.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Moon Tears - Lagrimas De Luna at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: 'Moon Tears,' the largest exhibition ever of the Mapuche culture from Chile, features more than 700 exquisite pieces of silver jewelry passed down from grandmother to granddaughter. Beyond beautiful works of art, the jewelry, textiles, and sacred objects in the exhibition record the cosmology, history, and ancestry of the Mapuche that continue to guide their public and medicinal ceremonies.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Collecting History: 125 Years of the National Philatelic Collection at National Postal Museum
properties.description: The National Philatelic Collection celebrates its 125th anniversary in 2011, making it the oldest intact national stamp collection in the world. 'Collecting History' remembers a few of the hundreds of donors who have given their collections to the Smithsonian for the benefit of the nation. It explores the decisive role of twelve successive curators in developing the national collection and exhibiting it to the public. Lastly, it invites you to consider the importance of this national treasure and reflect on what the material within it can teach us about world cultures and the American experience.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Celebrating 100 Years at National Museum of Natural History at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: The Natural History Building first opened its doors to the public on March 17, 1910. The Museum celebrates its 100th birthday with a special exhibition featuring archival and modern photographs highlighting many facets of this building - its people, collections, exhibitions, and outreach throughout the years. Photographs both old and new give snapshots of life and work at the Museum over the past 100 years.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Bird House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Check out feathers, bones, and eggs and learn about the fascinating world of birds.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Perspectives: Hai Bo at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Trained as a painter, Hai Bo, born in 1962 in Changchun, China, took up photography in the 1980s as he became captivated by the camera's ability to stop time and evoke memories. For over two decades, he has been returning to his hometown in Jilin Province to capture the people and places of his youth, creating deeply moving portraits of resilience amidst the growing isolation of rural China. On display are five stunning, large scale photographs from his Northern Series. These images allow viewers to enter the vast panoramas of the artist's childhood memories, observe the subtle changes of nature across seasons, and encounter the gentle transience of life.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Impressionism and the Gilded Age at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The museum has one of the finest and largest collections from the last quarter of the nineteenth century, including impressionist and Gilded Age works.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Nature Kids at Anita C Leight Estuary Center
properties.description: Explore and discover the natural world around us during the winter season through sensory activities, songs, movement and a short hike.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Nature Tots: Winter Bird Buddies at The National Wildlife Visitor Center
properties.description: An event for children to learn about wintertime birds through stories, crafts and outdoor adventures.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Inked Souls 3 at Art Whino
properties.description: Art Whino joins forces with Tagur Footwear once again for their third edition of 'Inked Souls,' an exhibition featuring customized sneakers and fine art by local, national and international leaders in the pop surrealism/urban contemporary art movement.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: 'Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow' is the first major survey of the artist's work and features nearly fifty paintings and works on paper from private and public collections. The exhibition traces Rockman's artistic development from the mid-1980s to the present.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Great Ape Research Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Meet a cognitive researcher and learn about studies being conducted with the Zoo's orangutans and gorillas.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Pre-K Nature Drop in at Marshy Point Nature Center
properties.description: Introduce your little ones to nature's wonders while enjoying stories, crafts, games, songs, and outdoor activities together.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Cultural Center Exhibition: V Inter-American Biennial of Video Art at Inter-American Development Bank Cultural Center
properties.description: 20 videos from 11 countries, including Puerto Rico, comprise the 5th edition of the IDB Cultural Center Video Biennial. Winning and selected videos, from an international call to Latin American and Caribbean artists for 5-minute videos, creatively explore and broaden the discussion of factors that affect the social, cultural and economic environments in the Region. Exhibition includes First, Second and Third Prize winners, Honorable Mentions, and additional entries selected from among 223 sent by artists from 20 countries.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Orangutan Crossing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: See the orangutans traveling on the Zoo's Orangutan Transport System, or O Line. The best time to see them is between 11 am and 11:30 am (weather dependent).

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Amazon Fish Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Thousands of fish species live in the Amazon River Basin. Meet some of them during this feeding in Amazonia.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Octopus Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn more about the giant Pacific octopus, a predator that demonstrates dynamic hunting behaviors.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Bird Enrichment Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Watch birds forage and catch their food mid-flight, as a keeper or volunteer narrates in the Indoor Flight Room.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Hide/Seek: Difference and Desire in American Portraiture at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: 'Hide/Seek' considers such themes as the role of sexual difference in depicting modern America; how artists explored the fluidity of sexuality and gender; how major themes in modern art - especially abstraction - were influenced by social marginalization; and how art reflected society's evolving and changing attitudes toward sexuality, desire, and romantic attachment.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Elvis at 21: Photographs by Alfred Wertheimer at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: In 1956, Alfred Wertheimer photographed a young and relatively unknown Elvis Presley. Wertheimer's images, taken before record-setting singles, broadcast specials, and hyped Hollywood films, reveal a rock !n' roll legend on the verge of superstardom. 'Elvis at 21: Photographs by Alfred Wertheimer,' a new Smithsonian traveling exhibition, presents 56 of these striking images.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: One Life: Katharine Graham at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: Newspaper publisher Katharine Graham (1917-2001) led an extraordinary life in extraordinary times. Born into privilege, she was catapulted onto the international stage as publisher of The Washington Post during the Watergate scandal. The exhibition includes several photographs to narrate key moments in her life including a portrait by Richard Avedon, drawings, original newspapers from the time of the Watergate scandal, the Pulitzer Prize for her memoir, 'Personal History' (1998) and video of a Living Self-Portrait interview of Graham by former Portrait Gallery director Marc Pachter. Amy Henderson is the curator for this exhibition.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Impressionism and the Gilded Age at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The museum has one of the finest and largest collections from the last quarter of the nineteenth century, including impressionist and Gilded Age works.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Glimpse of the Past: A Neighborhood Evolves at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: 'Glimpse of the Past' is a photographic exploration of the neighborhood surrounding the Patent Office Building, one of the oldest federal buildings in Washington, D.C. and now home to the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery and the Smithsonian American Art Museum. On display are images from the 1850s to the present, which showcase the rise, decline and revival of the area. An interactive in the exhibition will also feature snapshots of the area during the 1960s and 1970s made by Washingtonian Chris Earnshaw.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: John Gossage: the Pond at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The installation of 'John Gossage: The Pond' celebrates the recent gift to the museum of this remarkable photographic series and the re-issue of one of the most influential photography books of the past three decades.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Sloth Bear Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Find out what and how these Asian bears eat.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: 'Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow' is the first major survey of the artist's work and features nearly fifty paintings and works on paper from private and public collections. The exhibition traces Rockman's artistic development from the mid-1980s to the present.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Meet A Great Ape Keeper at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about the fascinating world of apes. A keeper will speak about gorillas or orangutans.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Inked Souls 3 at Art Whino
properties.description: Art Whino joins forces with Tagur Footwear once again for their third edition of 'Inked Souls,' an exhibition featuring customized sneakers and fine art by local, national and international leaders in the pop surrealism/urban contemporary art movement.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Small Mammal Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: At this feeding demonstration, you'll learn more about what small mammals like to eat.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Aspen Hill Library Book Discussion at Aspen Hill Library
properties.description: Join others for a discussion of 'Harry Truman's Excellent Adventure,' the true story of a great American road trip. Copies will be available at the Information Desk.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Spider Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Get up close and personal with the golden orb weaver spiders.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Meet A Small Mammal at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: An animal keeper will introduce you to one of the Zoo's small mammals like an armadillo or naked mole-rat.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Crustacean Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Zoo visitors will have the opportunity to see the crabs, lobsters, shrimp and crayfish get their dinner.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Jayme Stone at The Kennedy Center - Concert Hall
properties.description: Banjo virtuoso Jayme Stone plays with a "unique style that bridges the space between bluegrass and contemporary jazz." Boulder Weekly

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Boris Arratia at Laporta's Restaurant
properties.description: Boris Arratia plays Latin jazz guitar and flamenco.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Jayme Stone at Kennedy Center - Millennium Stage
properties.description: Banjo virtuoso Jayme Stone plays with a "unique style that bridges the space between bluegrass and contemporary jazz." Boulder Weekly

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Pub Quiz at Ireland's Four Courts
Jan 10, 2011: Bohemian Caverns Jazz Orchestra at Bohemian Caverns
properties.description: The Brad Linde Ensemble brings big band swing to the Bohemian Caverns as their resident jazz orchestra.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: John Kocur, Jazz Saxophonist at Blues Alley
properties.description: This jazz saxophonist and composer performs original compositions and other works rooted in the American jazz, classical and rock traditions.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: A Shadow of Honor at Church Street Theater
properties.description: Keegan Theatre presents the world premiere of Peter Coy's 'A Shadow of Honor,' where past and present collide as a new generation faces the repercussions of war - and something has to give.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Sarah McLachlan at DAR Constitution Hall
properties.description: From her 1988 debut release 'Touch' to her breakthrough album 'Surfacing,' Canadian singer/songwriter Sarah McLachlan is one of the most emotionally revealing performers working today. Aside from creating and headlining the "Lilith Fair" tours, McLachlan has also championed an outreach program bringing music education classes to inner city youths whose school music programs have been affected by budget cuts. Sarah returns to the road in support of her new release, 'Afterglow.'

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Phil Cunneff New Quartet at Cat's Eye Pub
properties.description: Philip Cunneff is a multiple percussion instrumentalist. He is best known as leader of the Philip Cunneff Trio and drummer for Steve Kramer's Bluesicians.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: John Kocur, Jazz Saxophonist at Blues Alley
properties.description: This jazz saxophonist and composer performs original compositions and other works rooted in the American jazz, classical and rock traditions.

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Jammin’ Java’s Mid-Atlantic Band Battle IIII at Jammin' Java
properties.description: Jammin Java presents The FOURTH Mid-Atlantic Band Battle. Everyone had such a killer time at the 1st, 2nd and 3rd Battle that we’re doing it all over again! We are searching for the best bands of any genre from up-and-down the East Coast to prove that they have what it takes to win $2500 CASH, your own headlining show at Jammin Java, Studio time @ Cue Recording Studios w/ producer Jim Ebert and Gift Certificates from Chuck Levin’s Washington Music Center for the top 4 bands. Here's how it works: 1. Apply to compete in the Battle. Only 24 bands will be accepted. 2. Compete in one of four preliminary rounds on January 10, 11, 12 and 13. Six bands compete per night. One winner per night moves on to the finals. 3. Four bands compete in the finals on Friday, February 18th. 4. Win the Battle and you get $2500 CASH, your own headlining show at Jammin Java, Studio time @ Cue Recording Studios w/ producer Jim Ebert and Gift Certificates from Chuck Levin’s Washington Music Center for the top 4 bands. This is a great opportunity for some MAJOR CASH for your band (buy a van, new gear, add to your recording fund?) as well as tons of exposure to many industry professionals. It's also a great way for us at Jammin Java to check out your band in consideration for future shows. ALL GENRES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY TO THE BATTLE! Whether you are acoustic, rock, latin, bluegrass, funk, folk, electronic, reggae, hip-hop, or anything else, we want you! TO APPLY: go to myspace.com/jjbandbattle and fill out the form OR email jjbandbattle@gmail.com with the following info: Band Name: Contact Person: Email: Phone: Myspace URL: Location: The application deadline is Saturday, November 20th.http://www.myspace.com/jjbandbattle

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Adobe-ActionScript 3.0 for Adobe Flash Professionals at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classes Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (3 day class) 1/10-12, 3/21-23, 5/23-25, 7/18-20, 9/14-16, 11/21-23 Description ActionScript 3.0 for Adobe Flash Professionals provides experienced Flash designers with the knowledge and hands-on practice they need to create dynamically generated event-driven animation and interactive projects with Flash. The course teaches fundamental programming techniques. It begins by introducing core concepts including instance names, variables, functions, properties, and methods; then proceeds through conditions, loops, event handling, and animating with ActionScript. Audience To take this course, you should have: * Completed the Adobe Flash Fundamentals: An Introduction to Flash course, or have equivalent experience. * The desire to learn how to program Flash content using ActionScript 3.0. Lesson 1: Using Code Snippets and Navigating the Flash Timeline * Placing code on the Flash timeline * Adding Actionscript using Code Snippets Lesson 2: Working with Events and Functions * Creating event listeners and event handling functions * Creating navigation with a button click Lesson 3: Creating Animation with ActionScript * Controlling MovieClip properties with ActionScript * Creating animation with Actionscript. Lesson 4: Creating ActionScript in External Files * Creating an external ActionScript file * Creating instances of a class file in Flash * Building a painting program Lesson 5: Using ActionScript and Components to Load Content * Using Components to quickly build a portfolio site * Using the UILoader component * Using the List component * Loading SWF files into a UILoader component * Adding scroll bar component to a text field Lesson 6: Creating Preloaders in ActionScript 3.0 * Creating a text field and progress bar to track loading * Inserting ActionScript to track progress of the UILoader component * Building a custom progress bar Lesson 7: Using Arrays and Loops in ActionScript 3.0 * Using for loops to automate processes. * Working with Arrays and loops * Adding MovieClip instances to the stage from the Library * Generating multiple instances with a for loop * Creating animation using ENTER_FRAME * Creating Drag and Drop functionality * Testing for Collisions * Building a simple game Lesson 8: Creating and Formatting Text with Actionscript * Creating a TLF TextField with Actionscript * Loading external documents in a Textfield * Formatting Text with the TextFormat class * Creating a ScrollBar with Actionscript Lesson 9: Controlling Sound with ActionScript * The Sound, SoundChannel, and SoundTransform classes * Setting the song titles using a for loop * Making the sliders invisible until needed * Programming the buttons to select songs * Controlling the visibility of the volume and pan controls * Adding a listener for the ID3 tags of an MP3 file * Adding the slider controls Lesson 10: Working with an XML Playlist * Building a reusable, custom MP3 player * Understanding the basic structure of an XML file * Using XML instead of an Array for reusability * Loading an external playlist using the URLLoader class * Creating hyperlinks using XML data * Navigating through the song list Lesson 11: Using ActionScript and Components to Control Video * Adding the FLVPlayback component to play video * Configuring the FLVPlayback component * Adding ActionScript control of FLVPlayback properties * Adding the FLVCaptioning component * Playing multiple video files from an XML playlist * Using the full-screen publish settings Lesson 12: Delving Deeper into Graphics and Animation with ActionScript * Inverse kinematics in Flash CS5 * Working with IK animation in ActionScript * Creating Sound and SoundChannel instances * Playing and stopping the sound effects * Accessing the user's webcam or video camera using ActionScript * Using the Bitmap and BitmapData classes * Examining the Pixel Bender Toolkit Lesson 13: Printing and Sending Email with ActionScript * Adding a simple email link * Sending email from Flash * Adding printing capabilities with the PrintJob class Lesson 14: Creating Adobe AIR Applications with Flash and ActionScript * Creating an AIR desktop application * AIR-specific ActionScript * Flash publish settings for an AIR project * Including a file in the AIR application Lesson 15: Using Third-Party Libraries to Extend Actionscript * Going beyond the classes built into Flash * Downloading and Installing Papervision 3D and Caurina Transitions * Using Papervision 3D to create a 3D video cube * Using Caurina Transitions to add transitions to 3D objects

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Adobe-Introduction to Premiere Pro at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classes Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (3 day class) (2011)1/10-12, 2/28-3/2, 3/30-4/1, 6/13-15, 8/8-10 Course Outline: Note: The curricula below comprise activities typically covered in a class at this skill level. Lesson 1: Video Essentials * RGB color model * Frame size * Pixel Aspect Ratio * Alpha Channels * Frame Rate * Time Code * Interpreting Footage * Introduction to codecs and maintaining quality in your Multicamera editing Lesson 10: Adding Video Effects * Sampling some basic video effects * Applying effects to multiple clips * Adding keyframing effects * Adding keyframe interpolation and velocity * Adding lighting effects * Creating custom presets Lesson 11: Acquiring and Editing Audio * Setting up a basic voice-recording area * Voicing professional narrations * Creating a high-quality aural experience * Examining audio characteristics * Adjusting audio volume * Adjusting audio gain * Adding J-cuts and L-cuts Lesson 12: Working with Color, Nested Sequences, and Shortcuts * An overview of properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Adobe-Photoshop Fundamentals: An Introduction to Photoshop at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classes Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (3 day class) (2011)1/10-12, 2/14-16, 4/18-20, 6/20-22, 8/15-17 This 3-day course provides a thorough overview of the interface, the tools, the features, tricks, and tips for using Photoshop CS4. The course is an ideal combination of instructor-led demonstration and hands-on practice. Who Should Attend? Adobe Photoshop has become an industry standard for so many different disciplines including desktop publishing, multimedia design, web design, digital video editing, and much more. Photoshop is often a prerequisite for many other software programs, and is the one program that everyone in every area of digital media should know. Course Outline: Lesson 1: Understanding how Digital images work * Understanding RGB and CMYK color models * Image size * Resolution (PPI and DPI) * Pixel Spect Ratio Lesson 2: Getting to Know the Work Area * Starting to work in Adobe Photoshop * Using the tools * Using the options bar and other panels * Undoing actions in Photoshop * Customizing the workspace * Finding resources for using Photoshop Lesson 3:Cropping and Image * Straightening and cropping an image * Making automatic adjustments * Removing a color cast * Manually adjusting the tonal range Lesson 4: Photo Corrections * Using the Spot Healing Brush tool * Using the Healing Brush and Patch tools * Replacing colors in an image * Adjusting lightness with the Dodge tool * Adjusting saturation with the Sponge tool * Comparing automatic and manual results * Repairing areas with the Clone Stamp tool * Applying the Unsharp Mask filter Lesson 5: Working with Selections * About selecting and selection tools * Getting started * Using the Quick Selection tool * Moving a selected area * Manipulating selections * Using the Magic Wand tool * Selecting with the lasso tools * Rotating a selection * Selecting with the Magnetic Lasso tool * Cropping an image and erasing within a selection * Refining the edge of a selection Lesson 6: Layer Basics * About layers *Getting started *Using the Layers panel *Difference between Opacity and Fill *Locking a layer (transparency, image pixels, position and the entire layer) The only critical one is transparency *Rearranging layers *Adding a layer mask *White for opacity, black for transparency *Applying a gradient to a layer *Flattening and saving files Lesson 7: Layer Styles *Applying a layer style *Adding a drop shadow *Adding a stroke *Understanding Global light *Other styles *Saving a style *Using the styles panel Lesson 8:Masks and Channels * Working with masks and channels *Creating a quick mask *Editing a mask *Loading a mask as a selection *Applying filters to a mask *Applying effects using a gradient mask Lesson 9: Using Channels Panel for selection * Getting started *The Channels Panel *Viewing channels *Choosing the right channel *Adjusting individual channels *Increasing contrast *Painting with Black and white *Removing the background from an image *Moving layers between documents *Inverting a mask Lesson 10: Layer Mask (Pixel Mask) * Creating a Layer Mask *Controlling masks *Using the Mask Panel *Viewing the Channel Panel for the Layer Mask *Disabling, Viewing, Deleting, and applying a Layer Mask Lesson 11: : Adjustment layers & clipping masks * Getting Started *Using adjustment layers *Grouping *clipping masks *Using type as a mask Lesson 12: Correcting and Enhancing Digital Photographs * Getting Started *Photo Merge *Auto-align layers *Content-aware scaling Lesson 13: Vanishing Point * Correcting digital photographs in Photoshop *Editing images with a vanishing-point perspective *Correcting image distortion Lesson 14: Typographic Design * About type *Getting started *Creating a clipping mask from type *Creating a design element from type *Using interactive formatting controls *Warping point type *Designing a paragraph of type *Difference between point and paragraph text *Warping a layer

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Adobe-Flash Fundamentals: An Introduction to Flash at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classesdc_reception@yahoo.com Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (3 day class) 1/10-12, 3/7-9, 5/4-6, 6/29-7/1, 8/8-10, 10/10-12, 12/14-16 Description Flash is one of the most engaging and innovative, and versatile technologies available - allowing the creation of pretty much anything from simple slideshows, animated banners and icons and cartoons, to Rich Internet Applications, Interactive videos, and dynamic user interfaces for web sites, kiosks, or DVDs. The possibilities are endless, except that now, it just got better. In 2010, Adobe released Flash CS5, which boasts a whole host of new features, including a new text engine, a Code Snippets panel to Reduce the ActionScript® 3.0 learning curve, enhanced Creative Suite integration, video improvements, new attributes to the Bones tool, new brushes for the Deco tool, and much more. Like before, Flash offers full ActionScript 3.0 support, a PSD and AI importer, Tweening, animation, etc. In this course you'll learn Flash CS5 from the ground up. What you will learn * The ins and outs of the Flash CS5 interface * How to use all of Flash CS5's essential features, such as text, graphics, and animation * How to use video and sound effectively in Flash * Using Illustrator and Photoshop files in Flash * Basics of ActionScript 3.0 * Building Flash user interfaces rapidly using components * Optimizing and publishing your Flash movies * Best practices and much more Lesson 1: Getting Acquainted * Starting Flash and Opening a File * Getting to Know the Work Area * Working with the Library Panel * Understanding the Timeline * Organizing Layers in the Timeline * Using the Property Inspector * Using the Tools Panel * Undoing Steps in Flash * Previewing Your Movie Lesson 2: Working with Graphics * Shapes, Primitives and Objects * Understanding Strokes and Fills * Creating Rectangles and Ovals * Using the Pen Tool * Using a Gradient Fill * Making Selections * Making Patterns * Creating Curves Lesson 3: Creating and Editing Symbols * Importing Photoshop and Illustrator Files * Creating Symbols * Editing and Managing Symbols * Changing the Color Effect of Instances * Understanding Blend Effects * Applying Filters for Special Effects * Positioning in 3D Space Lesson 4: Adding Animation * About Animation * Animating Position * Changing the Pacing and Timing * Animating Transparency * Animating Filters * Animating Transformations * Changing the Path of the Motion * Swapping Tween Targets * Creating Nested Animations * Using the Motion Editor * Easing * Animating 3D Motion Lesson 5: Articulated Motion and Morphing * Articulated Motion with Inverse Kinematics * Constraining Joints * Inverse Kinematics with Shapes * Armature Options * Morphing with Shape Tweens * Using Shape Hints Lesson 6: Creating Interactive Navigation * About Interactive Movies * Designing a Layout * Creating Buttons * Understanding ActionScript 3.0 * Using the Code Snippets Panel * Adding a Stop Action * Creating Event Handlers for Buttons * Creating Destination Keyframes * Playing Animation at the Destination * Animated Buttons Lesson 7: Using Text * Create and style text * About Static and Dynamic text * UIScroll bar Component * Add Hyperlinks to text * Load external text * Understanding when to embed fonts Lesson 8: Working with Sound and Video * Using and understanding sound in Flash * Understanding Flash Video * Using the Adobe Media Encoder * Understanding Encoding Options * FLV Playback Component * Playback of External Video * Working with Video and Transparency * Embedding Flash Video Lesson 9: Loading and Controlling Flash Content * Loading External Content * Removing External Content * Controlling Movie Clips * Creating Masks Lesson 10: Publishing * Testing a Flash Document * Understanding the Bandwidth Profiler * Publishing a Movie for the Web * Publishing a Movie for the Web

properties.title: Jan 10, 2011: Apple-Sound 101 - Introduction to Sound Editing in Final Cut Studio at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classes Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (2 days) (2011) 1/10-11, 2/17-18, 4/7-8,4/25-26 Course Descriptions This two-day class guides you through editing audio files, repair field recordings, perform multitrack arranging and mixing, synchronize audio and video, analyze and fix common audio problems, and perform other creative sound design techniques. This course focuses on practical, professional techniques used to add professional music and sound effects to video and multimedia projects. Who should attend? This course is designed for those who want to learn the basics of audio content creation, editing, and mixing and who prefer hands-on, interactive instruction to best explore the audio functionality of Final Cut Studio. Prerequisites Students should have the following prerequisite knowledge prior to attending the course: • Basic knowledge of the Macintosh OS OS • Basic knowledge of audio terminology is recommended Course Outline - Day 1 Lesson 1: Sound Editing Basics • Understanding the Sound Editing Process, Cleaning Dialogue, Integrating Sound Effects and Adding Music Lesson 2: Sound Mixing Basics • Offline Mixing, Online Mixing, Mixing in Soundtrack Pro, Sending to a STP Multitrack Project, Performing Basic Mixing Tasks, Adjusting and Automating Levels, Conforming and Returning to Final Cut Pro Lesson 3: Getting to Know Soundtrack Pro • Using the Frequency Spectrum View, Controlling the Spectrum, and Working with Frequency Lesson 4: Recording in Soundtrack Pro • Understanding Panes, Tabs and Window Layouts, Setting Project Properties, Controlling Playback, Navigating the Timeline and Exploring the Track Header Lesson 5: Fixing Audio Files • Sending to an STP Audio File Project, Exploring the File Editor Project View, Navigating the Waveform Display, Redrawing Waveforms, Analyzing an Audio File, Working with Actions, Noise Reduction, Returning to Final Cut Pro and Saving an Action as an AppleScript Lesson 6: Recording Dialogue • Opening a Multitrack Project, Working with Tracks, Setting Up for Recording, Recording a Single Take, Collecting the Project and Using Punch Recording Course Outline - Day 2 Lesson 7: Editing Dialogue • Using the Editing Tools, Arranging Clips, Basic Mixing, Using the Noise Reduction Process and Adding with Ambient Noise Lesson 8: Multitake Editing (ADR) • Using the Multitake Editor, Adding a Guide Track, Organizing the Takes, Slipping Takes, Creating a Composite Take and Smoothing Transitions Lesson 9: Spotting Sound Effects • Setting Up for Spotting, Exploring the Bin and the Browser, Using the the Multipoint Video HUD, Three-Point Edits, Using Fades and Using Envelopes to Create Fades Lesson 10: Scoring Using Loops • Setting Up for Music Production, the Search Tab, Adding Music Beds, Working with Loops and Using Markers Lesson 11: Mixing Multitrack Projects Exploring the Mixer, Using Submixes, Adding DSP Effects to Mixer Tracks, Automating the Mix, Using Busses, Using the Master Channel and Surround Sound Mixing
