properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Great Ape Research Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Meet a cognitive researcher and learn about studies being conducted with the Zoo's orangutans and gorillas.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cosmic Adventures Traveling Planetarium at Marilyn J Praisner Branch Library (Fairland)
properties.description: Learn more about the stars and constellations, explore the phases of the moon, and zoom into some of the planets of the solar system. Due to the interactive nature of the program, space is limited. Tickets will be given out 30 minutes before the program. Admittance is for one child accompanied by an adult. Admittance is for one program only.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cosmic Adventures Traveling Planetarium at Fairland Regional Library
properties.description: Learn more about the stars and constellations, explore the phases of the moon, and zoom into some of the planets of the solar system. Due to the interactive nature of the program, space is limited. Tickets will be given out 30 minutes before the program. Admittance is for one child accompanied by an adult. Admittance is for one program only.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Designing Tomorrow: America's World's Fairs of the 1930s at National Building Museum
properties.description: A first-of-its-kind exhibition, 'Designing Tomorrow' will feature nearly 200 never-before-assembled artifacts including building models, architectural remnants, drawings, paintings, prints, furniture, an original RCA TRK-12 television, Elektro the Moto-Man robot, and period film footage.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: African Mosaic: Celebrating A Decade of Collecting at Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring 112 objects that represent ten years of building a permanent collection, reflects the diversity and outstanding quality of Africa's arts. On view are a variety of objects from gold jewelry and wooden figures to a coffin in the shape of a cell phone.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Wounded in Action: an Art Exhibition of Orthopaedic Advancements at National Museum of Health and Medicine
properties.description: This is an exhibit of art works inspired by experiences with the wounds of war.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Spencer Finch: My Business, With the Cloud at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: Drawing from the history and physical environment of Washington, D.C., Spencer Finch's project explores - through sculptural installations, photographs, and drawings - the poetic, physical, and meteorological aspects of these natural phenomena.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Ice Skating at the Sculpture Garden at National Gallery of Art - Sculpture Garden
properties.description: The National Gallery of Art Sculpture Garden ice-skating rink is open mid-November through mid-March, weather permitting. View magnificent works of sculpture while skating in the open air and enjoying music from the state-of-the-art sound system. Skate rental: $3 (ID required); locker rental: 50 cents ($5 deposit required).

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Victory Mail at National Postal Museum
properties.description: This exhibit showcases the Museum's collection of World War II V-Mail correspondence. V for Victory, a popular symbol of the Second World War, was the inspiration for the name of this new fangled correspondence style.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Negro Leagues Baseball Stamp Art at National Postal Museum
properties.description: This exhibit, on view in the Museum's Franklin Foyer, features original art produced by Kadir Nelson for the creation of the Negro Leagues Baseball stamps, which pay tribute to the all-black professional baseball leagues that operated from 1920 to approximately 1960.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Beasts on Parchment: Picturing Animals in Medieval Manuscripts at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: This exhibition will explore the variety of beasts that swarm, creep, and scramble across the pages of medieval manuscripts and their allegorical significance.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Winter Bird Walks at The National Wildlife Visitor Center
properties.description: Search for wintering birds on the grounds as you enjoy the winter weather.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Birding Trip: Woodbridge/Occoquan Bay at Audubon Naturalist Society
properties.description: Songbirds, waterfowl, eagles, and other raptors. Meet time/place: 7:30 a.m. inside refuge at central parking. Make reservation (6-person limit) with leader Jim Waggener, 703-567-3555.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Colors of the Oasis: Central Asian Ikats at Textile Museum
properties.description: This exhibit will feature a selection from the 148 high caliber Central Asian ikats given to The Textile Museum by collector Murad Megalli in 2005. The stunning, colorful textiles on view will include coats for men and women, and women's dresses and pants, as well as cradle covers, hangings and fragments - all on view for the first time ever.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Fly Now! - Aviation Posters From the Smithsonian Institution's National Air and Space Museum at College Park Aviation Museum
properties.description: The exhibition features 40 aviation posters from 1860 to the present, representing countries from North and South America, Europe, Asia, and Africa. The history of advertising, technology, business, transportation, tourism, and cultural geography inform the exhibition, providing a unique approach to aviation history.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Word, Shout, Song: Lorenzo Dow Turner - Connecting Communities Through Language at Anacostia Community Museum
properties.description: 'Word, Shout, Song' documents the historical journey made by people from Africa, their language, and their music, to the Americas. Through words, music, and story, Lorenzo Dow Turner discovered in the 1930s that the Gullah people of Georgia and South Carolina still possessed parts of the culture and language of their enslaved ancestors, which had long been believed lost.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Constructed Spaces: Contemporary Color Photography at Academy Art Museum
properties.description: Curated by Brian Young, this show focuses on large-scale, color images that appear to be frozen in time and place.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Beyond: Visions of Our Solar System at National Air and Space Museum
properties.description: 'Beyond: Visions of Our Solar System,' an exhibition of 148 brilliant color and black-and-white photographs - images from space captured by unmanned interplanetary probes - will be on display at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum. In addition, works by artist Michael Benson, which combine art, science and photography, will be on view in the second-floor Art Gallery. The exhibition is the result of Benson's research in the archives of NASA, the European Space Agency and other sources of space photographs. The artist processed and combined the images to create large-format composite views of planets and moons. Photos in the exhibition cover objects from the entire solar system.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Tours of the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House at Mary Mc Leod Bethune Council
properties.description: Mary McLeod Bethune achieved her greatest national and international recognition at the Washington, DC townhouse at 1318 Vermont Avenue, NW, that is now this Historic Site. It was the first headquarters of the National Council of Negro Women (NCNW) and was her last home in Washington, DC. From here, Bethune and the Council spearheaded strategies and developed programs that advanced the interests of African American women and the Black community.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: House of the Temple Tours at House of the Temple
properties.description: This "one of a kind architectural masterpiece" was designed and built between 1911 and 1915. The tours begin every fifteen minutes beginning at 10 am with the last tour leaving at 4 pm.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Fly Now! - Aviation Posters From the Smithsonian Institution's National Air and Space Museum at College Park Aviation Museum
properties.description: The exhibition features 40 aviation posters from 1860 to the present, representing countries from North and South America, Europe, Asia, and Africa. The history of advertising, technology, business, transportation, tourism, and cultural geography inform the exhibition, providing a unique approach to aviation history.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Washington: Symbol and City at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibition explores how residents experience the city and how Washington itself expresses the tension between the demands of a working seat of government and the desire for a national symbol, and the hopes and needs of an evolving city.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: What Makes Us Smile at American Visionary Art Museum
properties.description: This exhibition, curated by master humorist and creator of 'The Simpsons' Matt Groening, artist Gary Panter, and AVAM Founder Rebecca Hoffberger, will focus on the timeless and global phenomena of smiling, laughter and humor and will include contributions by dozens of artists.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Winter Bird Walks at The National Wildlife Visitor Center
properties.description: Search for wintering birds on the grounds as you enjoy the winter weather.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Then & Now: A Historic & Modern Visual Tour of York County at Historical Society Museum
properties.description: This exhibit juxtaposes historical photographs, maps and prints of York County with current images and objects.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Abraham Lincoln: an Extraordinary Life at National Museum of American History
properties.description: Each highlighted object on display will be augmented with personal stories told by Lincoln and the people who knew him best. The exhibition will showcase more than 60 historical treasures associated with Lincoln's life from an iron wedge he used to split wood in the early 1830s in New Salem, IL, to his iconic top hat he wore the night he was shot at Ford's Theatre.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Paper Engineering: Fold, Pull, Pop & Turn at National Museum of American History
properties.description: Movable, pop-up, folding and multiple-construction books from the year 1570 to the present day comprise this Smithsonian Institution Libraries' exhibition highlighting innovative book design. The exhibition features the art of paper engineering in the production of books with moving parts, such as peep shows, volvelles, accordion books and pop-up books, published from the 15th century to modern times. Viewers will receive an in-depth look at the structure and design of pop-up and movable books, with over 50 works demonstrating the diverse methods designers and paper engineers use to magically transform flat, static images in basic paper constructions into dynamic, multi-dimensional forms.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Winter Walks Along the Canal at Audubon Naturalist Society
properties.description: Join our Senior Naturalist for one or all of these walks along the C&O Canal, as we look for over-wintering birds and other wildlife, practice winter botany skills, and enjoy the expansive views along the Potomac River which this season provides. Carpooling will be available from Woodend.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Moon Tears - Lagrimas De Luna at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: 'Moon Tears,' the largest exhibition ever of the Mapuche culture from Chile, features more than 700 exquisite pieces of silver jewelry passed down from grandmother to granddaughter. Beyond beautiful works of art, the jewelry, textiles, and sacred objects in the exhibition record the cosmology, history, and ancestry of the Mapuche that continue to guide their public and medicinal ceremonies.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Collecting History: 125 Years of the National Philatelic Collection at National Postal Museum
properties.description: The National Philatelic Collection celebrates its 125th anniversary in 2011, making it the oldest intact national stamp collection in the world. 'Collecting History' remembers a few of the hundreds of donors who have given their collections to the Smithsonian for the benefit of the nation. It explores the decisive role of twelve successive curators in developing the national collection and exhibiting it to the public. Lastly, it invites you to consider the importance of this national treasure and reflect on what the material within it can teach us about world cultures and the American experience.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guillermo Kuitca: Everything - Paintings and Works on Paper, 1980-2008 at Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden
properties.description: This exhibit presents the spectrum of Kuitca's thirty-five year career, from early pieces inspired by his experience in theater, with titles often drawn from music, to recent complex abstractions that evoke the history of modern painting.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Constructed Spaces: Contemporary Color Photography at Academy Art Museum
properties.description: Curated by Brian Young, this show focuses on large-scale, color images that appear to be frozen in time and place.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Written in Bone: Forensic Files of the 17th Century Chesapeake at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Human anatomy and forensic investigation provide intriguing information on people and events of America's past. This exhibition will examine history through 17th-century bone biographies, including those of colonists teetering on the edge of survival at Jamestown, VA, and those of wealthy and well-established individuals of St. Mary's City, MD.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Tint Tot at Long Branch Nature Center
properties.description: Tiny Tot programs provide a wonderful opportunity to interact one-on-one with your child while discovering the wonders of nature. Each fun and educational program will engage your child with hands-on learning, and may include a variety of activities like songs, crafts, finger plays and mini-hikes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Tours of the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House at Mary McLeod Bethune Council House
properties.description: Mary McLeod Bethune achieved her greatest national and international recognition at the Washington, DC townhouse at 1318 Vermont Avenue, NW, that is now this Historic Site. It was the first headquarters of the National Council of Negro Women (NCNW) and was her last home in Washington, DC. From here, Bethune and the Council spearheaded strategies and developed programs that advanced the interests of African American women and the Black community.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: America's Aquatic Treasures at National Aquarium
properties.description: The National Aquarium in Washington, DC, proudly introduces 'America's Aquatic Treasures,' which highlights the animals and habitats preserved and protected by our National Marine Sanctuaries Program.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Amphibians Gallery at National Aquarium
properties.description: Due to their unique biology and the habitats they live in, amphibians are very prone to depletion and mutation from pollution, habitat destruction, urbanization, and environmental change. Many of the amphibians in the United States are listed as endangered, threatened, or in need of protection. These animals, such as the eastern tiger salamander, are beautiful and rarely seen in the wild due to their elusive nature, but are now even harder to find due to dwindling populations. This gallery highlights salamanders, newts, frogs, and toads to display their amazing adaptations and biology.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Visionary Distillations at American Center for Physics
properties.description: 'Visionary Distillations' brings together the photographs of Robert Cassanova, the paintings of Kim Dylla and the sculptures of Minna Newman Nathanson. While their mediums differ, they each seek out the unexpected, and using their imagination, essentialize form to reveal fundamental patterns and connections.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: G-Men and Journalists at Newseum
properties.description: This exhibit, featuring approximately 200 artifacts, nearly 300 photographs, dozens of historic newspapers, interactive displays and more, reflects the sometimes cooperative, sometimes combative relationship between the FBI and the news media.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Elvis - His Groundbreaking, Hip-Shaking, Newsmaking Story at Newseum
properties.description: Experience the power of Elvis Presley and the explosive impact he had on music and popular culture. The exhibit opens in what would have been Presley's 75th birthday year. It tells the story of Presley as he was portrayed in the news media and explores how his music and physicality pushed the boundaries of mainstream taste and free expression. Produced in collaboration with Elvis Presley Enterprises Inc., the exhibit includes a number of rare objects from the vaults of Graceland that have never been publicly displayed, including private telegrams, letters and documents that chronicle Presley's rise as a music and media sensation. Also on display are rare photographs and original newspapers and magazines covering Presley's career, Presley's iconic 1957 Harley-Davidson motorcycle, the "American Eagle" jumpsuit and cape Presley wore during rehearsals for his 1973 "Aloha From Hawaii" concert and the gold-and-diamond belt presented to Presley in 1969 for breaking Las Vegas attendance records.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Covering Katrina at Newseum
properties.description: 'Covering Katrina' chronicles the dramatic tale of the media's reporting of the killer storm that struck the Gulf Coast. Never-before-displayed artifacts illustrate the professional challenges and personal losses reporters suffered covering the storm and the sometimes perilous conditions they faced. The exhibit also includes an original Newseum-produced video that features dramatic footage of storm coverage along with vivid and often emotional first-person accounts from newspaper editors and TV journalists who balanced objective reporting with their own personal frustrations.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Athlete: the Sports Illustrated Photography of Walter Iooss at Newseum
properties.description: On display are more than 40 photos from Iooss's nearly 50-year career, each accompanied by the story behind the image, told in Iooss's own words. The exhibit includes Iooss's most famous photograph, 'The Catch,' which captured the last-minute touchdown catch by San Francisco 49ers' receiver Dwight Clark that ended the Dallas Cowboys' Super Bowl dreams in 1982. Also included are Iooss's personal diaries, filled with collages of his photos, quirky headlines and his handwritten notes. In addition, the exhibit includes an original Newseum-produced video in which Iooss talks about his photos and the bond he forged with his subjects.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Wonder of Light: Touch and Learn at Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: On view in a case are objects from the museums' collections related to light, accompanied by a touch-screen table nearby featuring interactive activities for children that tell stories of light. The name of this exhibition is from the theme of the original Children's Room, "Knowledge begins with Wonder."

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Editors' Picks: the Best of Smithsonian Magazine's 7th Annual Photo Contest at Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: For its 7th annual photo contest, Smithsonian magazine received over 45,000 entries from the United States and around the world in the following five categories: Altered Images, Americana, The Natural World, People, and Travel. A panel of judges selected 50 finalists, 30 of which will be displayed in the Castle.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Then & Now: A Historic & Modern Visual Tour of York County at Historical Society Museum
properties.description: This exhibit juxtaposes historical photographs, maps and prints of York County with current images and objects.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Gods of Angkor: Bronzes From the National Museum of Cambodia at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Revealed through 36 exceptional works on display in the Gallery, the fascinating story of bronze sculpture and casting in Cambodia is revealed. Magnificent examples dating from the prehistoric period to the post-Angkorian period (third century BCE to sixteenth century CE) present the origins, uses, and techniques of bronze casting and the development of a distinctly Cambodian style.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Shaping History Through Service: the Walter Mills Story at Banneker Douglass Museum
properties.description: In 1939, Walter Mills, an educator at Parole Elementary School in Annapolis, MD, fought for African American teachers in Anne Arundel County to receive the same pay rate as white teachers. The court case was successfully argued by attorney and Maryland native Thurgood Marshall and brought an end to unequal pay for teachers in Anne Arundel County, and eventually the entire state of Maryland. This exhibition will include rarely seen photos, objects, and documents in the process of telling the life story of Walter Mills.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Daily Zoo Programs at The Maryland Zoo in Baltimore
properties.description: Every day you can enjoy special animal encounters throughout the zoo. Add one or more to your schedule to complete your day. Keeper Chat, feeding times and other activities are listed online.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: P(Art)Ners: Gifts From the Heather and Tony Podesta Collection at National Museum of Women in the Arts
properties.description: P(art)ners demonstrates the Podestas' shared collecting vision through a selection of nearly 30 photographs and sculptures drawn from more than 300 works that the couple has donated to NMWA.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tour of the Lincoln Memorial at Lincoln Memorial
properties.description: This presidential memorial prominently occupies the western terminus of the National Mall and offers unparalleled views toward many of the other presidential sites. The park staff offers daily interpretive tours every hour on the hour from 10 am-11 pm.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Word, Shout, Song: Lorenzo Dow Turner - Connecting Communities Through Language at Anacostia Community Museum
properties.description: 'Word, Shout, Song' documents the historical journey made by people from Africa, their language, and their music, to the Americas. Through words, music, and story, Lorenzo Dow Turner discovered in the 1930s that the Gullah people of Georgia and South Carolina still possessed parts of the culture and language of their enslaved ancestors, which had long been believed lost.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Great Cats Viewing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: You are invited to visit with the zoo's lions and tigers.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Discovering Rastafari at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Using artifacts, rare photographs, and ephemera to explore the origins and religious practices of the movement in Jamaica, this exhibition takes viewers beyond the popular Jamaican music known as reggae to the deeper roots of the Rastafari culture. Video footage featuring first-person testimony from male and female Rastafari of different ages, nationalities, and racial and class backgrounds speak to Rastafari of unity and to the spread of the movement across the Caribbean and beyond over the past three decades.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: German Drawings From the Walters' Collection at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: These German drawings from the mid-19th century are notable for their clear storytelling, appealing subject matter and precise draftsmanship. William Walters purchased most of the works in this exhibition during his time in Europe. Highlights include picturesque landscapes, charming animal studies and incisive character sketches.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Invertebrate House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Explore the complex, fascinating world of invertebrates: corals and crabs, ants and anemones, seashells and spiders. Feeding demonstrations take place every half-hour. Hands-on activities vary daily.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Beasts on Parchment: Picturing Animals in Medieval Manuscripts at The Walters Art Museum
properties.description: This exhibition will explore the variety of beasts that swarm, creep, and scramble across the pages of medieval manuscripts and their allegorical significance.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: East of the River: Continuity and Change at Historical Society of Washington, DC
properties.description: 'East of the River' insightfully explores the development of Washington communities east of the Anacostia River from a provocative yet universal perspective: the struggle over land, who owns it, who controls it, who profits from it, and how residents determine their own destiny. The timeline covers the region's Native Americans' beginning through the present and into the future.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Asia Trail Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about giant pandas, sloth bears, clouded leopards, and four other species living on Asia Trail.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Taking Shape: Ceramics in Southeast Asia at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Approximately 200 diverse and visually striking ceramic vessels from Southeast Asia are on display in this exhibit. 'Taking Shape' presents the two basic types of ceramics produced in Southeast Asia - soft, porous earthenware and high-fired stoneware.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Intersections Art Projects - Regi Muller at The Phillips Collection
properties.description: This spring Regi Muller transform the museum's Vradenburg Cafe by installing hundreds of peach-colored urethane Caps on its walls and windows. Trained as a textile and graphic designer, Muller lives in New York City. She is the winner of numerous awards and honors and has exhibited in her native Switzerland, as well as in the United States.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Elephant Viewing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: The Elephant House will be closed while a new home is built for the elephants. However, they will be on view in their outdoor habitats daily (weather dependent).

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Discovering the Civil War, Part Two: Consequences at National Archives
properties.description: This exhibit features the most extensive display ever assembled from the incomparable Civil War holdings of the National Archives. Through unusual perspectives, seldom-seen documents, and engaging interactive exhibits, everyone from novices to Civil War buffs can "discover" the Civil War. This exhibit is on display in the Lawrence F. O'Brien Gallery.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Charters of Freedom: Our Nation's Founding Documents at National Archives
properties.description: This exhibit takes a fresh look at the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Chinamania at Freer Gallery of Art
properties.description: Blue-and-white Chinese porcelain became a hot item in London in the 1870s, a craze the British press mockingly dubbed "Chinamania." James McNeill Whistler, an early collector of Chinese porcelain, helped stimulate this fad by depicting such wares in his paintings. The Chinamania exhibition at the Freer explores Chinese porcelain in Whistler's England, where it was first valued as aesthetic inspiration but soon proliferated as a commodity. Featured are twenty-three works of art: blue-and-white porcelain objects from the Peacock Room; eight wash drawings of Kangxi porcelain that Whistler produced for a collector's catalogue; and paintings, pastels, and etchings inspired by the artist's interest in porcelain.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Public Vaults at National Archives
properties.description: 'The Public Vaults' invites visitors into virtual stack areas to discover historic documents, films, maps, and photographs from the National Archives. In interactive displays, visitors may hear Presidents discuss some of the country's greatest challenges, step into the boots of soldiers on the front lines, or follow an investigation of the sinking of the Titanic. Look for a changing display of documents and artifacts from Ronald Reagan's administration in celebration of his 100th birthday.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: House of the Temple Tours at House of the Temple
properties.description: This "one of a kind architectural masterpiece" was designed and built between 1911 and 1915. The tours begin every fifteen minutes beginning at 10 am with the last tour leaving at 4 pm.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Perspectives: Hai Bo at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: Trained as a painter, Hai Bo, born in 1962 in Changchun, China, took up photography in the 1980s as he became captivated by the camera's ability to stop time and evoke memories. For over two decades, he has been returning to his hometown in Jilin Province to capture the people and places of his youth, creating deeply moving portraits of resilience amidst the growing isolation of rural China. On display are five stunning, large scale photographs from his Northern Series. These images allow viewers to enter the vast panoramas of the artist's childhood memories, observe the subtle changes of nature across seasons, and encounter the gentle transience of life.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Art of Gaman: Arts and Crafts From the Japanese American Internment Camps, 1942-1946 at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: This exhibit will showcase arts and crafts made by Japanese Americans in U.S. internment camps during World War II. On display will be more than 100 objects, many of which are on loan from former internees or their families. The exhibition is based on Delphine Hirasuna's 2005 book 'The Art of Gaman.'

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: A Revolution in Wood: the Bresler Collection at Renwick Gallery
properties.description: This exhibition celebrates the extraordinary recent gift of turned wood objects from collectors Fleur and Charles Bresler. The Bresler collection has a noticeably distinct aesthetic that emphasizes sculptural qualities and decorative motifs integrated into the whole form. The craftsmanship is exquisite and finely detailed. Wood turning has gained recognition as an art form since World War II. The exhibition will highlight contemporary wood turning's growing sophistication, and will feature sixty-six objects from the 1980s and 1990s, including a number of artworks that will be on public display for the first time.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Weaving Diversity - Textiles From Oaxaca at Mexican Cultural Institute - Washington, DC
properties.description: Representing three important collections from the Textile Museum of Oaxaca, the elaborate pieces on display will showcase historical indigenous attire worn since the 1950s, as well as creations that feature unique weaving techniques and original textures. The pieces featured in the show will also be for sale, with the proceeds going directly to sustainable development projects organized around the design, production and marketing of textiles to benefit the indigenous communities of Oaxaca and ensure the continuation of the tradition.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Celebrating 100 Years at National Museum of Natural History at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: The Natural History Building first opened its doors to the public on March 17, 1910. The Museum celebrates its 100th birthday with a special exhibition featuring archival and modern photographs highlighting many facets of this building - its people, collections, exhibitions, and outreach throughout the years. Photographs both old and new give snapshots of life and work at the Museum over the past 100 years.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Postal Inspectors: the Silent Service at National Postal Museum
properties.description: Today about 2,000 postal inspectors are at work across the United States investigating crimes against the mail. By visiting the museum and viewing this exhibit, you'll learn more about the inspectors and what their jobs entail. Sometimes called the silent service, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service is one of the oldest federal law enforcement agencies in the country.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Pre-Raphaelite Lens: British Photography and Painting, 1848-1875 at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: In the first survey of British art photography focusing on the 1850s and 1860s, some 110 photographs and 20 paintings and watercolors chronicle the roles photography and Pre-Raphaelite art played in changing concepts of vision and truth in representation.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: From Impressionism to Modernism: the Chester Dale Collection at National Gallery of Art - East Building
properties.description: This exhibit will bring together 84 of the finest French and American paintings that Chester Dale and his wife Maud, an artist and critic, assembled from the 1920s through the 1950s.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Tint Tot at Long Branch Nature Center
properties.description: Tiny Tot programs provide a wonderful opportunity to interact one-on-one with your child while discovering the wonders of nature. Each fun and educational program will engage your child with hands-on learning, and may include a variety of activities like songs, crafts, finger plays and mini-hikes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Tiny Tot at Gulf Branch Nature Center
properties.description: Tiny Tot programs provide a wonderful opportunity to interact one-on-one with your child while discovering the wonders of nature. Each fun and educational program will engage your child with hands-on learning, and may include a variety of activities like songs, crafts, finger plays and mini-hikes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Investigating Where We Live at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibition presents students' interpretations of D.C. neighborhoods through photography, writing, and original artwork. This year's participants explored Petworth, Trinidad, and the Southwest Waterfront in Washington, D.C.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Spencer Finch: My Business, With the Cloud at Corcoran Gallery of Art
properties.description: Drawing from the history and physical environment of Washington, D.C., Spencer Finch's project explores - through sculptural installations, photographs, and drawings - the poetic, physical, and meteorological aspects of these natural phenomena.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cyprus: Crossroads of Civilizations at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Located in the eastern Mediterranean Sea, the island of Cyprus has been a crossroads of civilizations for over 11,000 years. Explore the history of Cyprus through a rich collection of antiquities, most of which are traveling outside the country for the first time. Discover the ways in which the human endeavor has shaped and is shaped by the natural environment of this Mediterranean jewel.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: What Makes Us Smile at American Visionary Art Museum
properties.description: This exhibition, curated by master humorist and creator of 'The Simpsons' Matt Groening, artist Gary Panter, and AVAM Founder Rebecca Hoffberger, will focus on the timeless and global phenomena of smiling, laughter and humor and will include contributions by dozens of artists.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Primate Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about some of our closest relatives, great and lesser apes - gorillas, orangutans and gibbons - and discuss the idea of animal thinking.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Theo Eshetu: Brave New World at Smithsonian National Museum of African Art
properties.description: In this exhibit, Theo Eshetu explores such universal tensions as the relationship between nature and technology and the idea of life as a spectacle. He does so with images that map his personal geography: scenes from a dance performance he filmed at a restaurant in Bali, footage from visits to New York City and Ethiopia, and even a cameo appearance by a box of Kellogg's corn flakes. He collaborated with musician and sound designer Keir Fraser to produce the video's seductive and meditative soundtrack.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Small Mammal House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about a wide variety of mammals, including the three-banded armadillo, naked mole-rat, golden lion tamarin, and banded mongoose.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Hyperbolic Crochet Coral Reef at National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: The hyperbolic crochet coral reef has grown from the discovery that cutting-edge hyperbolic geometry could be found in the intricate structures of coral reefs and represented though the traditional handicraft of crochet. Experience this homage to the disappearing wonder, beauty, and diversity of living reefs that are threatened by pollution and global warming.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: The Body Inside and Out: Anatomical Literature and Art Theory Selections From the National Gallery of Art Library at National Gallery of Art - East Building
Jan 12, 2011: Seasons: Chinese Landscapes at Freer Gallery of Art
properties.description: To highlight its permanent collection, the museum presents 'Seasons,' a series of rotating exhibitions that underscores the importance of the seasons in Chinese and Japanese art and culture. The first exhibition in this series explores the moods of seasonal landscapes and related motifs: wandering in nature, composing poetry, and relaxing in the summer heat.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Kids' Farm Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about farming and how taking care of animals takes time, dedication, and knowledge.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Bird House Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Check out feathers, bones, and eggs and learn about the fascinating world of birds.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Books Without Words: the Visual Poetry of Elisabetta Gut at National Museum of Women in the Arts
properties.description: The exhibition will present 22 artists' books, collage-poems, book-objects and object-poems by Italian artist Elisabetta Gut (b. 1934). Her visual poetry is inspired by her dreams, memories, and love for music and poetry.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: LEGO Architecture: Towering Ambition at National Building Museum
properties.description: This exhibit features 15 LEGO models built by LEGO certified professional Adam Reed Tucker. The buildings and structures that Tucker has assembled are some of the most recognizable works of architecture in the world, including: the Empire State Building, the World Trade Center, Trump Tower, the St. Louis Arch, and the Burj Khalfia.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cheetah Conservation Station Interpreters at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Explore the world of the cheetah and other animals at the Cheetah Conservation Station, including Grevy's zebra and scimitar-horned oryx.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Walking Tour at US Naval Academy
properties.description: Upon arriving at The Armel-Leftwich Visitor Center, information specialists will welcome visitors to view a 12 minute film. A walking tour, led by professional, certified guide, will follow the film presentation. The walking tour takes approximately one hour and 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Fiona Tan: Rise and Fall at Arthur M Sackler Gallery
properties.description: This exhibition of photographs and videos by Fiona Tan, born in Indonesia in 1966 and now living in Amsterdam, is the first major presentation of her work in the United States. Tan's installations deftly meld the past with the present in profoundly evocative works that explore the power of images in constructing memories and histories. Whether drawing on old photographs, seventeenth-century Dutch painting, or nineteenth-century orientalist architecture, her conceptual and aesthetic approach adds a compelling dimension to understanding Asian art and culture in the world today.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Supporting the Force: Navy Supply in Action - Ready for Sea, Ready Ashore at United States Navy Memorial and Naval Heritage Center
properties.description: Navy Supply provides the "beans, bullets and black oil" that enable the US Navy to operate around the globe. Navy Supply touches the lives of every sailor with food, laundry, barbers, postal services and ship's stores. On display will be ship models, rare historic artifacts including an 1841 Navy Purser's uniform coat - the oldest known Navy Supply uniform - as well as a World War II WAVE uniform and the uniform and equipment worn by a Navy Advisor in the Vietnam War. In addition, the exhibit will honor the sailors of Navy Supply who've given their lives in the Global War on Terror and those who've received the Nation's top honors. Hands on activities for children include "build a meal" puzzles, interactive cargo handling display model and a "try-on trunk" with flight deck uniforms and equipment used during vertical replenishment operations. A full schedule of events will accompany the exhibit, including food tastings, films, lectures and equipment displays.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: A True North Britain - the Furniture of John Shearer, 1790-1820 at DAR Museum
properties.description: Noted not only for its form but also for the politically charged symbols inlaid in many pieces, the furniture created by John Shearer helps to explore early America's cultural ties to Great Britain during the most contentious period in the two nations' shared history.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Impressionism and the Gilded Age at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The museum has one of the finest and largest collections from the last quarter of the nineteenth century, including impressionist and Gilded Age works.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: No Edition: Paintly Prints by Lou Stovall at Addison Ripley Fine Art
Jan 12, 2011: Jim Sanborn: Photographs at Marsha Mateyka Gallery
Jan 12, 2011: Babies and Ones at Little Falls Library
properties.description: Introduce your child to the joys of reading with books, fingerplays, and music.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Shining Stars Preschool Storytime at Kensington Park Community Library
properties.description: Join others for interactive stories, songs, stretches, fingerplays and rhymes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: John Gossage: the Pond at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The installation of 'John Gossage: The Pond' celebrates the recent gift to the museum of this remarkable photographic series and the re-issue of one of the most influential photography books of the past three decades.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Mommy & Me (Or Daddy & Me) Ice Skating Classes! at Patterson Park
properties.description: Mimi DiPietro Ice Rink. One hour lesson + one hour free skate time. For children aged 2-5 years. $85 for 7 weeks or $5 per drop in. Call 410-396-9392 for more information or to sign up.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Inked Souls 3 at Art Whino
properties.description: Art Whino joins forces with Tagur Footwear once again for their third edition of 'Inked Souls,' an exhibition featuring customized sneakers and fine art by local, national and international leaders in the pop surrealism/urban contemporary art movement.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Arch AT Thompson at The Old Post Office Pavillion Food Court
properties.description: Arch "AT" Thompson is a gifted flutist/composer/arranger/performer who upholds a rich and diverse musical tradition that extends from the shores of the Caribbean Islands and on to North, Central and South America. His unique musical style blends classical, jazz, funk and Latin into a sensational sound.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: An Old Brick House in Georgian Style: 190 Years of History in the Beall-Dawson House at Beall-Dawson House
properties.description: This year-long retrospective of the Beall-Dawson House, built circa 1815, examines the architecture, landscape and history of the property from the perspective of the many individuals - free and enslaved - who lived, played, worked and died here.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Nurieh Mozaffari: Touch of Love at Parish Gallery
Jan 12, 2011: Ben Gest at Contemporary Museum
properties.description: 'Ben Gest: Commissure' is Part 3 of Project 20, a two-year celebration of the Contemporary Museum's 20th anniversary with exhibitions and projects curated by former Contemporary Museum directors, curators and exhibiting artists. Photographer Ben Gest creates complex and psychologically-charged portraits constructed from dozens and at times hundreds of digital photographs.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Impressionism and the Gilded Age at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The museum has one of the finest and largest collections from the last quarter of the nineteenth century, including impressionist and Gilded Age works.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: 'Alexis Rockman: A Fable for Tomorrow' is the first major survey of the artist's work and features nearly fifty paintings and works on paper from private and public collections. The exhibition traces Rockman's artistic development from the mid-1980s to the present.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Sloth Bear Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Find out what and how these Asian bears eat.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Elvis at 21: Photographs by Alfred Wertheimer at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: In 1956, Alfred Wertheimer photographed a young and relatively unknown Elvis Presley. Wertheimer's images, taken before record-setting singles, broadcast specials, and hyped Hollywood films, reveal a rock !n' roll legend on the verge of superstardom. 'Elvis at 21: Photographs by Alfred Wertheimer,' a new Smithsonian traveling exhibition, presents 56 of these striking images.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Glimpse of the Past: A Neighborhood Evolves at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: 'Glimpse of the Past' is a photographic exploration of the neighborhood surrounding the Patent Office Building, one of the oldest federal buildings in Washington, D.C. and now home to the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery and the Smithsonian American Art Museum. On display are images from the 1850s to the present, which showcase the rise, decline and revival of the area. An interactive in the exhibition will also feature snapshots of the area during the 1960s and 1970s made by Washingtonian Chris Earnshaw.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Meet A Great Ape Keeper at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn about the fascinating world of apes. A keeper will speak about gorillas or orangutans.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: One Life: Katharine Graham at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: Newspaper publisher Katharine Graham (1917-2001) led an extraordinary life in extraordinary times. Born into privilege, she was catapulted onto the international stage as publisher of The Washington Post during the Watergate scandal. The exhibition includes several photographs to narrate key moments in her life including a portrait by Richard Avedon, drawings, original newspapers from the time of the Watergate scandal, the Pulitzer Prize for her memoir, 'Personal History' (1998) and video of a Living Self-Portrait interview of Graham by former Portrait Gallery director Marc Pachter. Amy Henderson is the curator for this exhibition.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: John Gossage: the Pond at Smithsonian American Art Museum
properties.description: The installation of 'John Gossage: The Pond' celebrates the recent gift to the museum of this remarkable photographic series and the re-issue of one of the most influential photography books of the past three decades.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Hide/Seek: Difference and Desire in American Portraiture at National Portrait Gallery
properties.description: 'Hide/Seek' considers such themes as the role of sexual difference in depicting modern America; how artists explored the fluidity of sexuality and gender; how major themes in modern art - especially abstraction - were influenced by social marginalization; and how art reflected society's evolving and changing attitudes toward sexuality, desire, and romantic attachment.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Orangutan Crossing at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: See the orangutans traveling on the Zoo's Orangutan Transport System, or O Line. The best time to see them is between 11 am and 11:30 am (weather dependent).

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cultural Center Exhibition: V Inter-American Biennial of Video Art at Inter-American Development Bank Cultural Center
properties.description: 20 videos from 11 countries, including Puerto Rico, comprise the 5th edition of the IDB Cultural Center Video Biennial. Winning and selected videos, from an international call to Latin American and Caribbean artists for 5-minute videos, creatively explore and broaden the discussion of factors that affect the social, cultural and economic environments in the Region. Exhibition includes First, Second and Third Prize winners, Honorable Mentions, and additional entries selected from among 223 sent by artists from 20 countries.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Holiday Festival of Trains at Ellicott City Station at B & O Railroad Museum's Ellicott City Station
properties.description: This annual holiday celebration of toy trains and model railroading features a new multi-dimensional O-gauge model train layout, a Thomas the Tank engine layout and the Museum's permanent HO model train layout inside the Freight House. Meet Santa and Frosty the Snowman on certain weekends throughout the festival.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Great Ape Research Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Meet a cognitive researcher and learn about studies being conducted with the Zoo's orangutans and gorillas.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Octopus Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Learn more about the giant Pacific octopus, a predator that demonstrates dynamic hunting behaviors.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Bird Enrichment Demonstration at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Watch birds forage and catch their food mid-flight, as a keeper or volunteer narrates in the Indoor Flight Room.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Leslie Nolan - Off-Kilter at Touchstone Gallery
properties.description: This exhibit features color drenched figurative paintings by Leslie Nolan.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Nihal Kececi: Memories Matter at Touchstone Gallery
properties.description: This exhibit features a series of impressionistic paintings.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Yaw Obuobi: Rhythmic Pulse at International Visions
properties.description: On display in the gallery are yarn collages by Ghanaian artist Yaw Obuobi.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Amazon Fish Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Thousands of fish species live in the Amazon River Basin. Meet some of them during this feeding in Amazonia.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Jim Sanborn: Photographs at Marsha Mateyka Gallery
Jan 12, 2011: Anish Kapoor: Prints at Marsha Mateyka Gallery
Jan 12, 2011: Gene Davis: Drawings at Marsha Mateyka Gallery
Jan 12, 2011: No Edition: Paintly Prints by Lou Stovall at Addison Ripley Fine Art
Jan 12, 2011: Meet A Small Mammal at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: An animal keeper will introduce you to one of the Zoo's small mammals like an armadillo or naked mole-rat.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Lunchtime With Sharks at National Aquarium
properties.description: Watch as Aquarium staff feed the Leopard, Swell and Horn shark collection. Plus, learn what makes the ocean's top predators different from other fish.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Afternoon Tea: Yun Ha Byun, Pianist at Harmony Hall Regional Center
properties.description: Yun Ha Byun started her piano studies at the age of three in Seoul, Korea. She has studied at Indiana University with Edward Auer and was awarded the Music Dean's Award for Study, 2nd place in the Concerto Competition and a scholarship from the Minnesota Symphony Orchestra's Young Artist Competition.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Spider Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: Get up close and personal with the golden orb weaver spiders.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Small Mammal Feeding at The Smithsonian National Zoological Park
properties.description: At this feeding demonstration, you'll learn more about what small mammals like to eat.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tours of the Anderson House Museum at Anderson House Museum
properties.description: This museum houses artifacts from the Revolutionary War, portraits by early American artists, 18th-century paintings, 17th-century tapestries, decorative arts of Europe and Asia and displays of books, medals, swords, silver, glass, china and more.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tours of the Baltimore Basilica at Baltimore Basilica
properties.description: This tour includes all areas of the church, including the upper church, undercroft, Our Lady Seat of Wisdom Chapel, Crypt, Basilica Museum, and the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden (upon request). Tours last approximately 45 minutes to one hour. If you would like to incorporate the Pope John Paul II Prayer Garden into your tour, add another 15 minutes.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Take a Free Online Course in Authentic Kabbalah at Baltimore (online)
properties.description: Bnei Baruch Learning Center is holding a live, interactive, free video course What Does the Course Give You? A firm basis in authentic Kabbalah methodology, providing a deep understanding of nature, the world, and who you really are Practical tools with which to take control of every challenge in life by learning the real rules of the game A unique illumination that can be sensed only by the study of authentic Kabbalah texts, an illumination that reveals and helps you realize your life's true purpose Click here to register http://bit.ly/gDp7Ir contact person: Abraham Cohen phone #:1-877-788-3906 email: lc@kabbalah.info Kabbalah, spirituality, online courses, classes, zohar

A firm basis in authentic Kabbalah methodology, providing a deep understanding of nature, the world, and who you really are Practical tools with which to take control of every challenge in life by learning the real rules of the game A unique illumination that can be sensed only by the study of authentic Kabbalah texts, an illumination that reveals and helps you realize your life's true purpose Click here to register http://bit.ly/gDp7Ir contact person: Abraham Cohen phone #:1-877-788-3906 email: lc@kabbalah.info Kabbalah, spirituality, online courses, classes, zohar

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Cosmic Adventures Traveling Planetarium at Marilyn J Praisner Branch Library (Fairland)
properties.description: Learn more about the stars and constellations, explore the phases of the moon, and zoom into some of the planets of the solar system. Due to the interactive nature of the program, space is limited. Tickets will be given out 30 minutes before the program. Admittance is for one child accompanied by an adult. Admittance is for one program only.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Guided Tours of the Anderson House Museum at Anderson House Museum
properties.description: This museum houses artifacts from the Revolutionary War, portraits by early American artists, 18th-century paintings, 17th-century tapestries, decorative arts of Europe and Asia and displays of books, medals, swords, silver, glass, china and more.

properties.title: Jan 12, 2011: Long Branch Puppet Theater at Long Branch Nature Center

properties.title: Jan 13, 2011: Havre De Grace and Port Deposit Van Tour at Meadowside Nature Center
properties.description: Explore the history of these two small historic towns, located on the mouth of the Susquehanna River. We'll take a guided tour of Port Deposit (narrowest town in the US), featuring Tome Memorial United Methodist Church (c. 1872), Paw Paw Museum (c. 1821), and Bainbridge Naval Training Center, where half a million World War II recruits trained. We'll also look for American bald eagles that nest along the Susquehanna and feed off fish below Conowingo Dam. In the afternoon, we'll visit Havre de Grace, including the Concord Point Lighthouse and the Decoy Museum. Snow date 1/27. Naturalist: Sandy Staples.

Don't let that stop you - some of the world's most famous skeptics are teetotalers, and you are more than welcome to attend this gathering.

properties.description: Jammin Java presents The FOURTH Mid-Atlantic Band Battle. Everyone had such a killer time at the 1st, 2nd and 3rd Battle that we’re doing it all over again! We are searching for the best bands of any genre from up-and-down the East Coast to prove that they have what it takes to win $2500 CASH, your own headlining show at Jammin Java, Studio time @ Cue Recording Studios w/ producer Jim Ebert and Gift Certificates from Chuck Levin’s Washington Music Center for the top 4 bands. It's also a great way for us at Jammin Java to check out your band in consideration for future shows. ALL GENRES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY TO THE BATTLE! Whether you are acoustic, rock, latin, bluegrass, funk, folk, electronic, reggae, hip-hop, or anything else, we want you! TO APPLY: go to myspace.com/jjbandbattle and fill out the form OR email jjbandbattle@gmail.com with the following info: Band Name: Contact Person: Email: Phone: Myspace URL: Location: The application deadline is Saturday, November 20th.http://www.myspace.com/jjbandbattle

Jan 12, 2011: Apple-DVDSP 101 - An Introduction to DVD Studio Pro 4 at Future Media Concepts
properties.description: http://www.fmctraining.com/fmc.asp?l=Washington+DC&p2=Upcoming+Classes Contact:202-429-9700 / MartinD@FMCtraining.com (3 day class) (2011)1/12-14, 2/23-25 Course Description This three day hands-on course delves into the world of DVD authoring using DVD Studio Pro 4. In this comprehensive course students will learn everything they need to create a professional DVD title. This course guides students through every aspect of DVD authoring, from initial storyboarding to burning and replication. Using compelling media and a real-world production workflow, students will learn how to create amazing MPEG 2 video with Compressor as well as create eye-popping motion menus directly in DVD Studio Pro 4. Students will also "author" a DVD by creating buttons, interactive links, slideshows, playlists and even adding alternate audio stream and camera angles. Who Should Attend? This course is designed for those that want to learn the basics of authoring professional quality DVDs using DVD Studio Pro 4. The course is designed for those who prefer hands-on and interactive instruction to best explore the full functionality of DVD Studio Pro. Certification This course covers the requirements necessary to successfully become an Apple Certified Pro, Level 1 in DVD Studio Pro. Level 1 certification attests to basic operational knowledge of the application. DVD Studio Pro Level 1 certification also counts towards the new Final Cut Studio (FCS) Master Pro certification. FCS Master certification recognizes a Certified Pro's skills with the entire Final Cut Studio product suite. Since workflow is such a significant component of Final Cut Studio, users need certification in at least three of the applications to earn Master Certification. For details, please visit http://train.apple.com/certification/proapps.html Prerequisites Students should have the following prerequisite knowledge prior to attending the course: • Basic knowledge of the Macintosh OS Course Outline - Day 1 Lesson 1: Preparing Your First DVD Project • DVD Creation Process, DVD Specification Basics, About Configurations, Media for DVD Authoring, The palette, The Inspector, Using the Basic Menu Editor, Menus and Templates, Creating Simple Buttons, Using Drop Zone, Using Text Elements in Menus, SImulating, Burning a DVD, and Recordable Media. Lesson 2: Using the DVD Studio Pro Interface • Outline Tab, Connections Tab, Quadrants and tabs, Track Editor, Slideshow Editor, Story Editor, Script Editor, Asset Tab, and Creating a Simple One-track DVD. Lesson 3: Setting Up a New DVD Project • Storyboarding a DVD, Creating a New Project, Importing Assets, Asset Information, Simple Encoding, and Using Compressor to Encode a File. Lesson 4: Working with Tracks and Markers • Creating Tracks, Creating Chapter Markers, Track End Jumps, Setting Audio Stream Language Tags, and Adding an Alternate Audio Stream. Lesson 5: Creating Standard Menus • Adding a Background, Creating Buttons, Linking Buttons to Tracks, Creating a Menu Template, Creating Button Shapes, Adding Button Styles, Adding Text Objects, Adding Text to a Menu Background, Creating Drop Zones, Adding Graphics and Still Images, and Creating an Overlay and Button Highlights. Lesson 6: Creating Motion Menus and Chapter Index Menus • Converting a Still Menu to a Motion Menu, Authoring a Motion Menu, Motion Menu Loop Points, Chapter Index Menus, Creating a Scene Index Menu, Connecting from Menu Buttons, Adding Audio to Menus, and Using Transitions from Menu Buttons. Course Outline - Day 2 Lesson 7: Working with Slideshows •Slideshow Basics, Slideshow Still Images, Creating Slides, Adding Audio, Adding Individual Audio to One Slide, Slideshow Navigation, Using Transitions and Converting a Slideshow to a Video Track. Lesson 8: Working with Stories • Defining Stories, Story Marker Entry Points, Story End Jumps, Applying the 99-item Limit to Stories, and Using Transitions from Story Ends. Lesson 9: Subtitles and Closed Captions • Burn, Build, Format, Building the DVD Volume, the Log Tab, Emulating the DVD Volume from Hard Drive, Output Options, Adding Copy Protection, Burning a Single DVD, Writing a DLT Tape, and Formatting CMF Volume. Lesson 10: Building and Formatting • Burn, Build, Format, Building the DVD Volume, the Log Tab, Emulating the DVD Volume from Hard Drive, Output Options, Adding Copy Protection, Burning a Single DVD, Writing a DLT Tape, and Formatting CMF Volume. Lesson 11: Advanced Menu Design • Types of Menus, Creating a Menu in Photoshop, Refreshing Assets, Advanced Menu Audio, Using Advanced Overlays, Creating Layered Menus. Lesson 12: Finishing Your DVD • Testing Your Project, Building and Formatting a DVD, Using the Apple DVD Player, Burning a Disc Using the Burn Command, Choosing a Recordable DVD Media, Distribution of Your Completed DVD, Designing Disc Labels and DVD Case Inserts. Course Outline - Day 3 Lesson 13: Creating Transitions •Applying a Transition, Using a Video Transition, Using Alpha Transitions, Exploring the Asset Movie, Exploring the Background Matte Movie. Lesson 14: Working with Markers and Stories • Alternate Angles, Creating Multi-Angle Tracks, Creating Mixed-Angle Tracks, Targeting Alternate Angle Streams, About Alternate Angle Errors, Exploring Final Cut Pro Markers. Lesson 15: Encoding Video • Bit Budgeting, Encoding with DVD Studio Pro, Encoding with Compressor, Exporting MPEG-2, ACS via Compressor, Dialog Normalization, Compression Profiles, Surround Sound and Downmixing, and Exporting Intermediate Files. Lesson 16: Encoding Audio • Audio Formats for DVD VIdeo, Using Digital Audio Files, AC-3 Files, Encoding AC-3 with Compressor, Dialog Normalization, Compression Profiles, Surround Sound and Downmixing, and Exporting Intermediate Files. Lesson 17: Scripting • Scripting Basics, Scripting Simple Functions, Building a Play-all Script, Building a Return-to-Menu Script, Building a Menu Loop Script, Programming the Title Button, Scripting Audio Streams, Checking Aspect Ratio, and Using Jump Indirect. Lesson 18: HD DVD Authoring • About HD DVD, Upconverting and SD Project to HD DVD, Encoding for HD DVD, Building an HD DVD Project, Building an HD DVD Project, Formatting and HD DVD Project, and Playing an HD DVD Project.
